title: Production Operator I: 2nd and 3rd Shifts
description:
WHO WE ARE
Baldwin Richardson
Foods is focused on enriching the flavor of life. As a full-service liquid
products supplier and strategic partner to the food and beverage industry,
Baldwin Richardson Foods combines its formulation expertise and unique
packaging options with robust processing capabilities to produce high-quality
sauces, toppings, syrups, fillings, and shelf-stable beverages for the world's
most iconic Quick Service Restaurants (QSRs), Consumer Packaged Goods (CPG)
brands, and food service companies. Its state-of-the-art Innovation &
Culinary Center transforms trends and culinary inspiration into legendary
products through an award-winning commercialization process. The company also
manufactures and markets Mrs. Richardson's dessert sauces and Nance's
mustards/condiments in addition to producing finished goods for the private
label sector. BRF maintains its headquarters and a manufacturing facility in
Macedon, New York; with a Culinary Innovation Center in Westmont, Illinois; and
offices and manufacturing facilities in Williamson, New York; Pennsauken, New
Jersey; and Corona, California.
 
  
This role is in our
 Williamson, NY facility.
  
 Starting hourly rate is
 
$18 per hour (dependent on experience)
 
with a shift differential of
 $0.75/hour for 2nd shift, & $1.50/hour for 3rd shift.
2nd Shift (3:00PM - 11:30PM) and 3rd Shift (11:00PM - 7:30AM) openings
 These are 
direct hire roles, eligible for our fantastic benefits package (see below) 
the first of the month following your start date.
 
Eligible candidates 
must have reliable transportation
. The facilities are 
not on a bus route. 
WHAT WE NEED 
The Production Operator I (POI) role is the first level of training and development in our production function. A successful individual will have basic mechanical aptitude, desire to learn how to operate food packaging equipment, ability to follow clearly written instructions, and willingness to grow and develop in the manufacturing field.  Strong communication skills and team player attitude is a must.
WHAT YOU WILL DO 
Operate food packaging equipment and ensure that each component of the assigned line is functioning correctly.
Monitor the production process, make periodic checks, and adjusts equipment or work practices to maximize production efficiency, yields, quality, and safety; using appropriate foundational elements (Centerlines, CIL’s, Start-up/Shutdown Checklists, troubleshooting guides) while learning and growing within assigned production lines. 
Ensure Quality Standards are met (Weights, codes, packaging, placards, fill cards, filter checks, magnet checks, metal detecto checks).
Troubleshoot basic mechanical features, perform basic mechanical tasks such as slitter/chopper blade replacements, registration repair, greasing/lubricating equipment, line changeovers, Timing functions. 
Ensures that line conditions are acceptable to change from one product to another by evaluating that materials, paperwork, and equipment have been staged for changeover and notify Maintenance if repairs are needed. 
Communication: Across shifts in hand-overs, shift huddles, problems with Maintenances and leadership, share continuous improvement ideas. 
Meet and follow all safety, quality, and GMP standards. 
Correct usage of production systems such as Tulip and RedZone with correct coding and self-audit. 
Helps drive 5S standards.
WHAT YOU NEED TO BE SUCCESSFUL 
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. 
Required Education/Experience:
Minimum of 6 months previous work experience or equivalent education. 
Signed off on 0 to 3 production lines.
Successful completion of work instruction and SOP assessments as introduced by the company. 
Must obtain a satisfactory score on the mechanical aptitude assessment provided by the company.
Must obtain a satisfactory score on the critical thinking skills assessment provided by the company.
Preferred Education/Experience: 
High school diploma or general education degree (GED)
Forklift License
 
preferred
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
 
Must pass a mechanical aptitude assessment provided by Baldwin Richardson Foods. 
A continuous learning, and improvement, mindset is a must; there are many opportunities to learn and develop at BRF, but the individual needs to be motivated to engage in those opportunities. 
Effectively communicate information in one-on-one and small group situations.
Willingness to offer suggestions on ways to improve assigned work.
Ability to follow and implement written or oral instructions.
Team player and constructive conflict management are key skills for success.
Self-starter and disciplined.
Punctuality is a must.
Motivated to do your best work each day.
Language Ability:
 English fluency required to successfully speak, read, write, and comprehend and give directions in English and communicate with other employees in English as part of regular job duties. 
Math Ability:
 Ability to add and subtract two-digit numbers and to multiply and divide with 10's and 100's.
Reasoning Ability:
 Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out simple one- or two-step instructions. Ability to deal with standardized situations with only occasional variables or based on past experience or training.
Computer Skills:
 To perform this job successfully, an individual should have the ability to learn a computer system and enter information in English into a computer system (RedZone and/or Tulip).
Due to SQF regulations, all employees must be able to fluently read, write, and converse in the English language. 
 
At BRF, base pay is one part of our total compensation package, and is determined within a range. The base pay range for this role is 
$18.00 per hour 
with a shift differential of
 $0.75/hour for 2nd shift, & $1.50/hour for 3rd shift. 
Your base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location. 
 
You'll also receive a comprehensive benefits package including low premium and out of pocket cost medical, dental and vision coverage, 401k with company match, generous sick and vacation time, 9 paid holidays, birthday and floating holidays, volunteer time and more!
 
Read more about who we are at:
www.brfoods.com
 or 
www.linkedin.com/company/baldwin-richardson-foods

title: Facilities (Custodial) Technician
description:
WHO WE ARE
  
Baldwin
Richardson Foods is focused on enriching the flavor of life. As a full-service
liquid products supplier and strategic partner to the food and beverage
industry, Baldwin Richardson Foods combines its formulation expertise and
unique packaging options with robust processing capabilities to produce
high-quality sauces, toppings, syrups, fillings, and shelf-stable beverages for
the world's most iconic Quick Service Restaurants (QSRs), Consumer Packaged
Goods (CPG) brands, and food service companies. Its state-of-the-art Innovation
& Culinary Center transforms trends and culinary inspiration into legendary
products through an award-winning commercialization process. The company also
manufactures and markets Mrs. Richardson's dessert sauces and Nance's
mustards/condiments in addition to producing finished goods for the private
label sector. BRF maintains its headquarters and a manufacturing facility in
Macedon, New York; with a Culinary Innovation Center in Westmont, Illinois; and
offices and manufacturing facilities in Williamson, New York; Pennsauken, New
Jersey; and Corona, California. 
This role is in our production facility in Macedon, NY.
Starting pay rate is based on experience ($17-$20/hour).
We are hiring for our 3rd shift team (11:59am to 8:30am, M-F)
WHAT WE NEED
A highly motivated self-starter who will play an essential role in overseeing a variety of custodial tasks to maintain, clean, and preserve buildings and grounds. Will perform heavy cleaning duties, such as cleaning floors, washing walls and glass, and removing rubbish. This role requires a person who can work as part of the sanitation team or independently depending on the needs of the department.
WHAT YOU WILL DO
Monitor/Maintain restrooms, Cafeteria, and break areas for cleanliness and supplies. 
Vacuum office areas and clean all glass. 
Assist in maintaining and participate in the Baldwin Richardson Foods Recycling Program. 
Empty garbage containers in common areas and restrooms, ensuring general areas are free of litter or debris. 
Minor maintenance within office areas including changing light bulbs, hanging wall art, moving desks, and other tasks as required. 
Monitor building and grounds to ensure a neat and clean presentation and environment. 
Follow all written and verbal instructions. 
Ensure all supplies are stored in appropriate areas. 
May complete grounds maintenance duties such as trimming shrubbery, cultivating flower beds, and removing snow, ice and debris. 
Maintain tools and equipment in a clean, orderly and safe manner. 
Ensure security of building during and after completed jobs and report any security violations to management. 
Report the need for any major repairs to Manager/Supervisor. 
Report and repair emergency maintenance problems and/or environmental hazards immediately.
WHAT YOU NEED TO BE SUCCESSFUL 
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. 
One year of experience in a Janitorial/Facilities Maintenance role.
High School Diploma, or equivalent.
Basic mechanical knowledge (preferred).
Experience using chemicals/solutions required for deep cleaning processes (preferred).
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES:
Must have ability to function both inside and outside in all types of weather. 
Medium to heavy work requiring prolonged or repeated standing, walking, climbing, stooping, kneeling, crouching, and lifting (must be able to lift at least 50 lbs.). 
Must have experience with hand tools normally used in construction, maintenance, and landscaping. 
Requires basic knowledge of janitorial procedures. 
Due to SQF regulations, all employees must be able to fluently read, write, and converse in the English language.
At BRF, base pay is one part of our total compensation package, and is determined within a range.
 
At BRF, base pay is
one part of our total compensation package and is determined within a range.
The base pay range for this role is between $17 and $20 per hour. Your base
pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location. 
 


You'll also receive
a comprehensive benefits package including low premium and out of pocket cost
medical, dental and vision coverage, 401k with company match, generous sick and
vacation time, 9 paid holidays, birthday and floating holidays, volunteer time
and more!
 
Read more about who we are at:
www.brfoods.com
 or 
www.linkedin.com/company/baldwin-richardson-foods

title: Packaging Engineer Co-op (Summer-Fall 2024)
description:
WHAT WE NEED 
The Packaging Engineer Co-op will be assigned projects that align with their educational track and have a direct result and correlation to the packaging engineering best practices in food manufacturing.  The student will work directly with a wide variety of individuals within operations at our 
Macedon, NY
 facility.
WHAT YOU WILL DO 
Responsibilities will range from packaging material specification creation and updating, packaging material line trials and qualification, support investigation of new packaging or changes to existing packaging.
Work on implementing packaging cost savings initiative and build pipeline of ideas
.
Develop BRF Package material spec requirements.
Support packaging team on trial qualifications and startup on NPD & Renovation.
Build SOP for troubleshooting packaging issues to production line.
Deep dive of package sustainability trends in food industry.
WHAT YOU NEED TO BE SUCCESSFUL 
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.
Required Education/Experience:
Must be enrolled in B.S. in Packaging Science, Packaging Engineering, Packaging R&D, or related field.
Minimum completion of two years of program (must be going into 3rd or 4th year).
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities: 
Packaging materials BRF works with – Thermoformed trays, rigid bottles, flexible pouches, corrugated cases, labels, shrink films, induction seals, etc.
Packaging distribution/supply chain.
Printing/Artwork process of labels and cases.
Need to be able to work a variety of hours to enable data collection across all three shifts (earliest could be 6am, latest could be 8pm).
Solid educational understanding of data collection and analysis processes.
Intermediate skills in MS Office – Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.
Excellent project management, organizational, and follow-through skill sets.
Results-oriented professional with strong drive, high level of technical curiosity, strong attention to detail, and effective data-interpretation skills.
Ability to work autonomously.
Effective communication skills including the ability to facilitate, present, document, and work in a collaborative work style.
Due to SQF requirements, must be fluent, writing and speaking, in the English language.
The base pay rate for this role is 
$22.00 to $25.00
 per hour. Your base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location.
WHO WE ARE
  
Baldwin Richardson Foods, Co. is a global manufacturer of custom food and beverage ingredients and one of the largest African American family-owned and-operated businesses in the food industry. The Company has strong supply relationships with some of the world’s largest Consumer Packaged Goods (CPG), Quick Service Restaurant (QSR) and Food Service customers. Iconic, global food brands entrust Baldwin Richardson Foods as their partner to deliver the highest quality products that exceed industry standards. The Company also manufactures and markets Mrs. Richardson’s Ice Cream Toppings and Nance’s Mustards and Condiments. This role will be based in our 
Macedon, NY
 facility.
Read more about who we are at:
www.brfoods.com
 or 
www.linkedin.com/company/baldwin-richardson-foods

title: Forklift Driver (Williamson, NY - 2nd shift & 3rd shift)
description:
WHO WE ARE
Baldwin
Richardson Foods is focused on enriching the flavor of life. As a full-service
liquid products supplier and strategic partner to the food and beverage
industry, Baldwin Richardson Foods combines its formulation expertise and
unique packaging options with robust processing capabilities to produce
high-quality sauces, toppings, syrups, fillings, and shelf-stable beverages for
the world's most iconic Quick Service Restaurants (QSRs), Consumer Packaged
Goods (CPG) brands, and food service companies. Its state-of-the-art Innovation
& Culinary Center transforms trends and culinary inspiration into legendary
products through an award-winning commercialization process. The company also
manufactures and markets Mrs. Richardson's dessert sauces and Nance's
mustards/condiments in addition to producing finished goods for the private
label sector. BRF maintains its headquarters and a manufacturing facility in
Macedon, New York; with a Culinary Innovation Center in Westmont, Illinois; and
offices and manufacturing facilities in Williamson, New York; Pennsauken, New
Jersey; and Corona, California
.  
This role is in our Williamson, NY facility.
We are currently hiring for 2nd shift (3pm to 11:30pm) and 3rd shift (11pm - 7:30am).
Starting hourly rate is 
$18.00/hour+ (dependent on experience)
 
with a shift differential of $0.75/hour for 2nd shift, & $1.50/hour for 3rd shift.
These are 
direct hire roles, eligible for our fantastic benefits package (see below)
 
the first of the month following your start date.
Eligible candidates 
must have reliable transportation
. The facilities are 
not on a bus route.
 
WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING
You will help to ensure an efficient and safe, transportation and storage of food ingredients, packaging, and finished product by: 
Driving forklifts to load, unload, and, store food products, equipment, or other materials. 
Operating forklifts and other equipment in a safe manner by following the BRF safety procedures. 
Following Standard Operating Procedures, Bills of Lading, and Pick Lists. 
Inputting transactions in SAP to update inventory. 
Assisting as assigned in the organization and cleaning of docks, rack storage areas, and facility. 
Highly technical operation required as some areas of facility have close spacing
WHAT YOU NEED TO BE SUCCESSFUL
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. 
A minimum of one-year of forklift operation experience
Minimum of six months of continuous experience in a manufacturing or industrial food production facility and/or an equivalent combination of education and experience. 
Forklift License preferred but not required, will certify. 
Education: High School Diploma or equivalent preferred
Effectively read the Standard Operating Procedures, Bills of Lading, and Pick Lists, which are written in the English language, and complete associated paperwork.  Fluently read and write in English language to ensure paperwork and record keeping is completed to SQF standards.
Be able to accurately follow directions, work effectively in teams, and contribute a positive attitude each day. 
Work in a manufacturing environment, which includes fluctuation in heat, moisture and noise. 
Wear Food Manufacturing GMP Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) - hard hat, hairnet (head and beard if applicable), steel toes shoes/boots, face mask 
At BRF, base pay is one part of our total compensation package, and is determined within a range. The base pay range for this role is between 
$18 and $24 per hour
.  Your base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location. 
 
You'll also receive a comprehensive benefits package including low premium and out of pocket cost medical, dental and vision coverage, 401k with company match, generous sick and vacation time, 9 paid holidays, birthday and floating holidays, volunteer time and more!
 
Read more about who we are at:
www.brfoods.com
 or

description:
WHO WE ARE
Baldwin Richardson
Foods is focused on enriching the flavor of life. As a full-service liquid
products supplier and strategic partner to the food and beverage industry,

brands, and food service companies. Its state-of-the-art Innovation &
Culinary Center transforms trends and culinary inspiration into legendary
products through an award-winning commercialization process. The company also
manufactures and markets Mrs. Richardson's dessert sauces and Nance's
mustards/condiments in addition to producing finished goods for the private
label sector. BRF maintains its headquarters and a manufacturing facility in
Macedon, New York; with a Culinary Innovation Center in Westmont, Illinois; and
offices and manufacturing facilities in Williamson, New York; Pennsauken, New
Jersey; and Corona, California.
  
This role is in our
 Macedon, NY facility.
  
 Starting hourly rate is
 
$16.50 - $17 per hour (dependent on experience)
 
with a shift differential of
 $0.75/hour for 2nd shift, & $1.50/hour for 3rd shift.
 These are 
direct hire roles, eligible for our fantastic benefits package (see below) 
the first of the month following your start date.
 
Eligible candidates 
must have reliable transportation
. The facilities are 
not on a bus route. 
WHAT WE NEED
The Assistant Production Operator (APO) role is an entry-level position which supports the production process through a variety of activities.  Support and adherence to our 5S environment is a key component to all our production roles.
WHAT YOU WILL DO 
Performs packing, stacking, and inspection requirements for each of the different production lines. 
Prepares packaging for filling at the appropriate line. 
Communicates production concerns to line leaders, supervisors, mechanics, and quality control. 
Completes material handling as needed to keep the line supplied. 
Operates equipment such as labelers, case erectors, case packers. 
Performs and documents verification checks to ensure output of acceptable products accurately. 
Verify proper codes are on all packaging. 
Follow proper Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP) including wearing personal protective equipment. 
Adheres to all safety requirements. 
Assist Operators in meeting line requirements to ensure fluent delivery of cases to the end customer.
Clean, organize, perform rework, dumps bottles and other tasks associated with driving performance efficiency in the operation of the manufacturing environment.  
Learn 5S standards and help to drive them throughout all assigned activities. 
WHAT YOU NEED TO BE SUCCESSFUL 
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. 
Required Education/Experience: 
No prior work experience is required.  
Preferred Education/Experience: 
High school diploma or general education degree (GED).
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
 
Continuous learning, and improvement, mindset is a must; there are many opportunities to learn and develop at BRF, but the individual needs to be motivated to engage in those opportunities. 
Effectively communicate information in one-on-one and small group situations.
Willingness to offer suggestions on ways to improve assigned work.
Ability to follow and implement written or oral instructions.
Team player and constructive conflict management are key skills for success.
Self-starter and disciplined.
Punctuality is a must.
Motivated to do your best work each day.
Work in a manufacturing environment, which includes fluctuation in heat, moisture, and noise.
Wear Food Manufacturing GMP Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) - hard hat, hairnet (head and beard if applicable), steel toes shoes/boots, face mask, no facial piercings, false eyelashes or fake fingernails.
Language Ability: 
English fluency required to successfully speak, read, write, and comprehend directions in English and communicate with other employees in English as part of regular job duties. 
Computer Skills: 
To perform this job successfully, an individual should have the ability to enter information, on an occasional basis, into production computer systems.
Math Ability: 
Ability to add and subtract two-digit numbers and to multiply and divide with 10's and 100's.
Due to SQF regulations, all employees must be able to fluently read, write, and converse in the English language.
At BRF, base pay is one part of our total compensation package and is determined within a range. The base pay range for this role is between 
$16.50 and $17.00 per hour with a shift differential of 
$0.75/hour for 2nd shift, & $1.50/hour for 3rd shift.
 Your base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location. 
 
You'll also receive a comprehensive benefits package including low premium and out of pocket cost medical, dental and vision coverage, 401k with company match, generous sick and vacation time, 9 paid holidays, birthday and floating holidays, volunteer time and more!

title: Electromechanical Technician
description:
WHO WE ARE
Baldwin Richardson Foods is focused on enriching the flavor of life. As a full-service liquid products supplier and strategic partner to the food and beverage industry, Baldwin Richardson Foods combines its formulation expertise and unique packaging options with robust processing capabilities to produce high-quality sauces, toppings, syrups, fillings, and shelf-stable beverages for the world's most iconic Quick Service Restaurants (QSRs), Consumer Packaged Goods (CPG) brands, and food service companies. Its state-of-the-art Innovation & Culinary Center transforms trends and culinary inspiration into legendary products through an award-winning commercialization process. The company also manufactures and markets Mrs. Richardson's dessert sauces and Nance's mustards/condiments in addition to producing finished goods for the private label sector. BRF maintains its headquarters and a manufacturing facility in Macedon, New York; with a Culinary Innovation Center in Westmont, Illinois; and offices and manufacturing facilities in Williamson, New York; Pennsauken, New Jersey; and Corona, California. 
This role is in our
 Macedon, NY facility.
  
 
WHAT WE NEED
Our Maintenance function is at the heart of keeping our business running and producing for our customers and consumers. In this role, under minimal supervision, you will perform advanced troubleshooting, repair, modification, installation, and preventative maintenance on electro mechanical and electrical systems, instrumentations, and PLCs utilizing standard work practices, to ensure production is supported, in a safe and efficient manner. 
WHAT YOU WILL DO
Following Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP) will support safety programs and policies to safeguard personal safety, product safety, company property, environmental and team member’s safety. 
Complete preventative maintenance on all equipment to maximize efficiencies and limit downtime. 
Support continuous improvement efforts by providing equipment and process expertise.
Troubleshoot and repair all plant-related electrical components including motors, servos, VFD’s, and PLC’s.
Leverage electrical expertise to support troubleshooting of process and support equipment.
Maintain electrical systems through execution of preventive maintenance programs.
May be involved with providing technical support to Operations Team for training and staff development (i.e. cross training production personnel for first level-maintenance activities). 
WHAT YOU NEED TO BE SUCCESSFUL
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily.   The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.  
HS Diploma required; two-year associate degree, licensing, or equivalent trade school technical training in related field highly preferred, but applicable experience will be consisted in lieu of licensing or education.
A minimum of three (3) years of electrical and electromechanical maintenance and troubleshooting experience (manufacturing, automotive, farming) is required.
Experience troubleshooting to identify root-cause issues on electromechanical and electrical equipment or components.
Experience in food and/or pharmaceutical manufacturing, specifically working to meet GMP, OSHA, FDA, EPA standards is preferred.
Skills and Knowledge: 
Proficiently reading and interpreting electrical schematics, Electrical, Instrumentation, Electronics/Controls.
Ability to use more complex analytical and measuring tools for vibration analysis, torque requirements and tolerances.
Proficiency with hand, portable power, and shop tools in the maintenance of manufacturing equipment is required.
Provide feedback and modification of PM’s based on observations
Provide feedback of overall health of machine centers
Able to use voltmeter and megger
Able to read ladder logic to diagnose production issues
Able to identify and replace faulty common electrical components (fuses, motors, photoeyes, relays, light ballast) 
Able to replace frequency drives and program
Familiar with HMI software and communication protocols
Familiarity with Fillers, Cappers, Case Packers, conveyors, tanks, and pumps 
Experience in the following areas is advantageous and would warrant a higher starting pay rate:
Ability to write ladder logic or modify
Ability to replace, modify HMI software and hardware
Use of more complex electrical tools (oscilloscope, data logger)
Well-rounded in all Allen Bradley software 
 
Abilities:
 
Curiosity to learn as well as mentor others on the team and organization.
Willingness to dig into the root-cause of failures, and ensure the repair is done through to completion. 
Ability and willingness to troubleshoot high-speed equipment in a safe, efficient manner
A pro-active, high-energy attitude, geared towards achieving continuous improvement
Strong interpersonal and communication skills and the ability to work effectively in a team environment with people of varying skills and backgrounds.
Able to work autonomously or in a team environment as a critical-thinker and decision-maker
Ability to independently prioritize and multitask effectively.
Must be willing and able to work overtime, including off-shift, weekends and holidays when required to support the production schedule.
 
At BRF, base pay is one part of our total compensation package and is determined within a range. The base pay range for this role is between 
$35.00 to $45.00 per hour
. This is to include a shift differential of 
$0.75/hour for 2nd shift, & $1.50/hour for 3rd shift.
 Your base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location. 
 
You'll also receive a comprehensive benefits package including low premium and out of pocket cost medical, dental and vision coverage, 401k with company match, generous sick and vacation time, 9 paid holidays, birthday and floating holidays, volunteer time and more!
 
Read more about who we are at:
www.brfoods.com
 or 
www.linkedin.com/company/baldwin-richardson-foods

title: Supervisor Product Quality (3rd Shift)
description:
WHO WE ARE
Baldwin Richardson
Foods is focused on enriching the flavor of life. As a full-service liquid
products supplier and strategic partner to the food and beverage industry,
Baldwin Richardson Foods combines its formulation expertise and unique
packaging options with robust processing capabilities to produce high-quality
sauces, toppings, syrups, fillings, and shelf-stable beverages for the world's
most iconic Quick Service Restaurants (QSRs), Consumer Packaged Goods (CPG)
brands, and food service companies. Its state-of-the-art Innovation &
Culinary Center transforms trends and culinary inspiration into legendary
products through an award-winning commercialization process. The company also
manufactures and markets Mrs. Richardson's dessert sauces and Nance's
mustards/condiments in addition to producing finished goods for the private
label sector. BRF maintains its headquarters and a manufacturing facility in
Macedon, New York; with a Culinary Innovation Center in Westmont, Illinois; and
offices and manufacturing facilities in Williamson, New York; Pennsauken, New
Jersey; and Corona, California.
OVERVIEW
This role leads the Quality Team to ensure the production of safe food by following Baldwin Richardson Foods’ Quality and Food Safety policies and procedures across the plant supply chain. The Supervisor executes the Food Safety Plan (FSP) and provides technical expertise to their cross-functional partners. 
This role is located at our Macedon, NY Facility, and is on our 3rd shift team (11:59pm to 8:30am, M-F).
Eligible candidates must have reliable transportation. The facility is not on a bus route.
WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING
• Carries out supervisory responsibilities in accordance with the organization's policies and applicable laws for Quality Assurance team
• Conducts root cause analysis and utilizes other quality /problem solving techniques to resolve quality issues including product holds, customer complaints, and GMP’s issues
• Tracks and reports metrics used to define performance that are aligned with company objectives
• Analyzes trends to understand performance opportunities and develops plan to close gaps
• Engages in non-conforming material process to ensure product is segregated and dispositioned
• Partners with Production, Sanitation, and Warehousing Departments to ensure GMP’s and preventive controls are followed
• Creates and provides training to BRF team members on quality and food safety as needed
• Supports plants’ readiness for governmental, 1st, 2nd and 3rd party audits (including SQF)
• Performs internal audits in production and storage areas and on procedures, policies and programs
• Identifies potential areas of compliance vulnerability and risk and provides guidance on system improvements and staff training
• Identifies areas to reduce waste, rework, and other inefficiencies with a focus on continuous process improvement
• Uses statistical tools to create and assess processes and track progress of quality programs
• Reviews adherence to budget on a monthly basis
• Acts as primary representative for all QA lab equipment and calibration of plant scales and balances
• Acts as a backup for Compliance Analyst, Quality Analyst or Quality Technician as needed
• Performs other related duties as assigned
• Supervises and coaches the Quality team members to achieve timely and accurate testing, inspection, and review of ingredients, products, packaging and records
• Manages the Quality team schedule to ensure coverage is available when needed
• Sets clear expectations and facilitates coaching and guidance to team members to foster achievement of departmental and company goals
• Inspires, empowers, and manages performance of Quality team members
• Cultivates talent by identifying development needs and opportunities, and provides training/coaching to team members
• Monitors team overtime spend and supply spend
 
A SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATE WILL HAVE
• Bachelor’s Degree in Chemistry, Biology, Microbiology, Food Science, or Chemical Engineering
 • 3-5 years of prior experience in food safety and quality
 • At least 1 year of prior supervisory experience required
 • PCQI, HACCP, and SPC trained preferred
 • Lean Six Sigma Green Belt preferred
WILL BE ABLE TO
• Display demonstratable knowledge of quality systems, food safety, and sanitation practices
 • Interpret data, understand process capability, and relate it to customer specifications
 • Display well-developed leadership capabilities and interpersonal skills
 • Work effectively in a fast-paced environment, with frequent change-overs, and quick commercialization process
 • Operate with strong, effective communication and interpersonal skills
 • Display good organizational skills and the ability to assemble resources needed to orchestrate multiple projects/activities and accomplish goals
 • Be proficient in time management
 • Be insightful and utilize creative problem solving, with the ability to exercise sound judgment and make discerning decisions based on accurate and timely analyses
 • Maintain unquestionable integrity and dependability
 • Continuously operate in a results-oriented fashion with a focused sense of urgency
At BRF, base pay is
one part of our total compensation package and is determined within a range.
The base pay range for this role is between $65,000 and $75,000K. Your base
pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location. 
 
You'll also receive
a comprehensive benefits package including low premium and out of pocket cost
medical, dental and vision coverage, 401k with company match, generous sick and
vacation time, 9 paid holidays, birthday and floating holidays, volunteer time
and more!

title: Maintenance Mechanic
description:
WHO WE ARE
  
Baldwin
Richardson Foods is focused on enriching the flavor of life. As a full-service
liquid products supplier and strategic partner to the food and beverage
industry, Baldwin Richardson Foods combines its formulation expertise and
unique packaging options with robust processing capabilities to produce
high-quality sauces, toppings, syrups, fillings, and shelf-stable beverages for
the world's most iconic Quick Service Restaurants (QSRs), Consumer Packaged
Goods (CPG) brands, and food service companies. Its state-of-the-art Innovation
& Culinary Center transforms trends and culinary inspiration into legendary
products through an award-winning commercialization process. The company also
manufactures and markets Mrs. Richardson's dessert sauces and Nance's
mustards/condiments in addition to producing finished goods for the private
label sector. BRF maintains its headquarters and a manufacturing facility in
Macedon, New York; with a Culinary Innovation Center in Westmont, Illinois; and
offices and manufacturing facilities in Williamson, New York; Pennsauken, New
Jersey; and Corona, California.
  
This role is in our Macedon, NY facility.
 
WHAT WE NEED 
 
Our Maintenance function is at the heart of keeping our business running and producing for our customers and consumers. In this role, under minimal supervision, the Maintenance Mechanic will perform troubleshooting, repair, modification, installation, and preventative maintenance on packaging and process equipment, utilizing standard work practices to ensure production is completed in a safe and efficient manner.
 
WHAT YOU WILL DO 
 
Following Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP) will support safety programs and policies to safeguard personal safety, product safety, company property, environmental and team member’s safety. 
Complete preventative maintenance on all equipment to maximize efficiencies and limit downtime. 
Support continuous improvement efforts by providing equipment and process expertise.
May be involved with providing technical support to Operations Team for training and staff development (i.e. cross training production personnel for first level-maintenance activities) 
Maintain packaging and process equipment through execution of preventive maintenance programs.
Troubleshoot and repair packaging and process equipment including Fillers, Cappers, Case Erectors, Case Packers, pumps, gearboxes, conveyors, etc.
 
REQUIRED EDUCATION / EXPERIENCE
 
HS Diploma required, two-year associate degree, licensing, or equivalent trade school technical training in related field highly preferred, but applicable experience will be consisted in lieu of licensing or education.
A minimum of three (3) years of mechanical troubleshooting and repair experience (manufacturing, automotive, farming, or related) is preferred.  
Experience troubleshooting to identify root-cause issues on mechanical equipment or components.
Experience in food and/or pharmaceutical manufacturing, specifically working to meet GMP, OSHA, FDA, EPA standards is preferred
 
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES:
 
Proficiency with hand, portable power, and shop tools in the maintenance of manufacturing equipment, ability to perform preventative maintenance procedures, we well as read and interpret mechanical drawings is required.
Ability to identify and replace components (gearboxes, pumps, cylinders), light fabrication and use of common shop tools (Drill press, Grinders, belt sanders), and mechanical troubleshooting (timing, clearance, sequence of operation) on high-speed equipment in a safe, efficient manner.
Experience in the following areas is advantageous and would warrant a higher starting pay rate:
Familiarity with packaging equipment such as: Fillers, Cappers, Case Packers, conveyors, tanks, and pumps. 
Ability to rebuild pumps, gearboxes, cylinders, and associated manufacturing equipment with minimal guidance.
Ability to use more complex analytical and measuring tools for vibration analysis, torque requirements and tolerances.
Ability to fabricate small machine parts
Experience with providing feedback and modifications to PMs and SOPs.
A pro-active, high-energy attitude, geared towards achieving continuous improvement.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills and the ability to work effectively in a team environment with people of varying skills and backgrounds.
Ability to independently prioritize and multitask effectively, as well as work autonomously or in a team environment as a critical-thinker and decision-maker.
Must be willing and able to work overtime
, including off-shift, weekends and holidays when required to support the production schedule.
Due to SQF regulations, all employees must be able to fluently read, write, and converse in the English language. 
 
At BRF, base pay is one part of our total compensation package and is determined within a range. 
The base pay range for this role is between 
$25.00 and $34.00 per hour
.  Your base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location. 
 
You'll also receive a comprehensive benefits package including low premium and out of pocket cost medical, dental and vision coverage, 401k with company match, generous sick and vacation time, 9 paid holidays, birthday and floating holidays, volunteer time and more!
 
Read more about who we are at:
www.brfoods.com
 or 
www.linkedin.com/company/baldwin-richardson-foods

Handles ingredients in a manner to maintain Food Safety standards.
Halts process and notify QA and Supervision in the event of any observed foreign materials, out-of-specification product, process failures, or any Food Safety or Quality concerns.

nowledge, Skills and Abilities:
 
Effectively read the cook cards, which are written in the English language, and complete batch paperwork.

Demonstrate basic mathematical competencies including, but not limited to, addition, subtraction, division, and multiplication of both fractions and whole numbers, and converting units of measurement.
Work in a manufacturing environment, which includes fluctuation in heat, moisture, and noise. 
Wear Food Manufacturing GMP Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) - hard hat, hairnet (head and beard if applicable), steel toes shoes/boots, and face mask.

title: Supervisor Production (Macedon, NY - Floating Shift)
description:
WHO WE ARE
  
Baldwin
Richardson Foods is focused on enriching the flavor of life. As a full-service
liquid products supplier and strategic partner to the food and beverage
industry, Baldwin Richardson Foods combines its formulation expertise and
unique packaging options with robust processing capabilities to produce
high-quality sauces, toppings, syrups, fillings, and shelf-stable beverages for
the world's most iconic Quick Service Restaurants (QSRs), Consumer Packaged
Goods (CPG) brands, and food service companies. Its state-of-the-art Innovation
& Culinary Center transforms trends and culinary inspiration into legendary
products through an award-winning commercialization process. The company also
manufactures and markets Mrs. Richardson's dessert sauces and Nance's
mustards/condiments in addition to producing finished goods for the private
label sector. BRF maintains its headquarters and a manufacturing facility in
Macedon, New York; with a Culinary Innovation Center in Westmont, Illinois; and
offices and manufacturing facilities in Williamson, New York; Pennsauken, New
Jersey; and Corona, California.
  
This Supervisor position is specific to our 
Macedon
, NY
 facility. As a Floating Shift Supervisor, this role will cover any supervision gaps (planned vacations, trainings, etc.) across all three shifts (1st, 2nd, 3rd) on an as-needed basis. When no supervision gaps exist, this role will be stationed on 1st shift (8:00am to 4:30pm).
Eligible candidates must have reliable transportation, as the facility is not on a bus route.
 
WHAT WE NEED 
 
The Production Supervisor is responsible for the management and coordination of the production team on shifts to meet customer needs and achieve standards related to cost, line efficiencies, waste, safety, and productivity.  The Supervisor leads key production initiatives such as safety, lean manufacturing programs, training, and other production-related activities as assigned. 
 
WHAT YOU WILL DO 
 
Leads production staff by clearly defining job responsibilities and standards of performance.  
Maintains workflow by monitoring the steps of the process; observing control points and equipment; monitoring personnel and resources; developing reporting procedures and systems; and initiating and fostering a spirit of cooperation within and between departments.
Utilizes machinery and personnel to get maximum production and efficiency for each production run. Works to reduce and eliminate all sources of waste including raw materials, time, and equipment failures. Evaluates performance and quality of the product.
Review final weekly production schedules to determine types, quantities, and specifications of products to plan department operations. 
Coordinates activities with the other shift superintendents according to work order requirements, established priorities and availability of employees, parts, materials and equipment.
Assures material, resources, and equipment preparedness in support of day-to-day production requirements.  
Conducts daily shift meetings to communicate required company and shift specific information through the utilization of Redzone. 
Ensures adequate preparation for incoming shift to be successful by providing concise, accurate and detailed shift reports to incoming shift which communicates variations and activities that could impact quality.
Evaluates and manages employee performance by clearly defining job responsibilities and standards of performance; providing clear, thorough, timely feedback; and addressing performance problems and issues promptly.  Thoroughly and sensitively provides constructive criticism.
Assists in interviewing and hiring of staff, on assigned shift, and cross-functionally as requested by other hiring managers.
Conducts ongoing assessment and training needs identification including maintaining the training / skill matrix for employees assigned to their team. 
Provides leadership and accountability for achieving targets for assigned areas of specialized responsibility such as safety, training, lean manufacturing, yield improvements, processing, and packaging continuous improvement.
Completes and analyzes Shift Reports on a daily basis and recommends continuous improvement initiatives for these production metrics with the Production Manager.
Assists the Production Manager with supporting the variable budgets for production operations and with analyzing and justifying capital requirements.
 
Supervisory Responsibilities:                                                                                   
 
Manages subordinate supervisors who supervise employees in the department. 
Is responsible for the overall direction, coordination, and evaluation of these units.  
Carries out supervisory responsibilities in accordance with the organization's policies and applicable laws.
Responsibilities include interviewing, hiring, and training employees; planning, assigning, and directing work; appraising performance; rewarding and disciplining employees; addressing complaints and resolving problems.
 
REQUIRED EDUCATION / EXPERIENCE
 
BS degree in Engineering strongly preferred with 1-2 years of co-op experience in a manufacturing setting, or a HS diploma plus five (5) years of manufacturing experience and two (2) years in a Production Supervisor (or equivalent) role.
 
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES:
 
 
Must possess a strong drive, demonstrating results-driven leadership to achieve desired outcomes and objectives.
Must possess a desire to receive mentorship and development for future opportunities in manufacturing leadership or process improvement leadership.
Working knowledge of applicable laws, rules and regulations (such as federal and state labor laws, EPA, OSHA and food safety) needed.
Organization skills and willingness to assume accountability for plant practices required.
Results driven leadership, with the ability to work under pressure in a fast-paced, time-sensitive. environment with shifting priorities and multiple deadlines.
Ability to build, coach and motivate personnel, while holding employees accountable for result.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Basic mechanical aptitude required. Position requires hands-on capability to operate all machinery and equipment. Training will be provided.
Ability to demonstrate leadership skills such as planning, organizing, staffing, leading, controlling & communicating.
Continuous improvement oriented.
Experience with RedZone preferred
Experience with SAP ERP a plus
Due to SQF regulations, all employees must be able to fluently read, write, and converse in the English language.
 
At BRF, base pay is one part of our total compensation package and is determined within a range. 
The base pay range for this role is between 
$70,000 and $80,000
.  Your base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location. 
 
You'll also receive a comprehensive benefits package including low premium and out of pocket cost medical, dental and vision coverage, 401k with company match, generous sick and vacation time, 9 paid holidays, birthday and floating holidays, volunteer time and more!

description:

Foods is focused on enriching the flavor of life. As a full-service liquid

products through an award-winning commercialization process. The company also

mustards/condiments in addition to producing finished goods for the private
label sector. BRF maintains its headquarters and a manufacturing facility in
Macedon, New York; with a Culinary Innovation Center in Westmont, Illinois; and
offices and manufacturing facilities in Williamson, New York; Pennsauken, New
Jersey; and Corona, California.


  
This role is in our
 Macedon, NY facility.
  
 Starting hourly rate is
 
$18 - $24 per hour (dependent on experience)
 
with a shift differential of
 $0.75/hour for 2nd shift, & $1.50/hour for 3rd shift.
 These are 
direct hire roles, eligible for our fantastic benefits package (see below) 
the first of the month following your start date.
 
Eligible candidates 
must have reliable transportation
. The facilities are 
not on a bus route. 
WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING
You will help to ensure an efficient and safe, transportation and storage of food ingredients, packaging, and finished product by: 
Driving forklifts to load, unload, and, store food products, equipment, or other materials. 
Operating forklifts and other equipment in a safe manner by following the BRF safety procedures. 
Following Standard Operating Procedures, Bills of Lading, and Pick Lists. 
Inputting transactions in SAP to update inventory. 
Assisting as assigned in the organization and cleaning of docks, rack storage areas, and facility. 
Highly technical operation required as some areas of facility have close spacing
WHAT YOU NEED TO BE SUCCESSFUL
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. 
A minimum of one-year of forklift operation experience
Minimum of six months of continuous experience in a manufacturing or industrial food production facility and/or an equivalent combination of education and experience. 
Forklift License preferred but not required, will certify. 
Education:  High School Diploma or equivalent preferred
Effectively read the Standard Operating Procedures, Bills of Lading, and Pick Lists, which are written in the English language, and complete associated paperwork.  Fluently read and write in English language to ensure paperwork and record keeping is completed to SQF standards.
Be able to accurately follow directions, work effectively in teams, and contribute a positive attitude each day. 
Work in a manufacturing environment, which includes fluctuation in heat, moisture and noise. 
Wear Food Manufacturing GMP Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) - hard hat, hairnet (head and beard if applicable), steel toes shoes/boots, face mask

title: Employee Relations Specialist
description:
WHO WE ARE
  
About Baldwin Richardson Foods 
Baldwin Richardson Foods is focused on enriching the flavor of life. As a full-service liquid products supplier and strategic partner to the food and beverage industry, Baldwin Richardson Foods combines its formulation expertise and unique packaging options with robust processing capabilities to produce high-quality sauces, toppings, syrups, fillings, and shelf-stable beverages for the world's most iconic Quick Service Restaurants (QSRs), Consumer Packaged Goods (CPG) brands, and food service companies. Its state-of-the-art Innovation & Culinary Center transforms trends and culinary inspiration into legendary products through an award-winning commercialization process. The company also manufactures and markets Mrs. Richardson's dessert sauces and Nance's mustards/condiments in addition to producing finished goods for the private label sector. BRF maintains its headquarters and a manufacturing facility in Macedon, New York; with a Culinary Innovation Center in Westmont, Illinois; and offices and manufacturing facilities in Williamson, New York; Pennsauken, New Jersey; and Corona, California. 
This role provides support to both our Macedon and Williamson manufacturing locations.
 
WHAT WE NEED 
 
The Employee Relations Specialist is the trusted partner for employee relations issues and concerns including conducting investigations, thorough documentation, providing recommendations to leaders, gaining required approvals, and ensuring thorough and timely resolution of issues. The role will provide consultation and support on HR and employee relations topics including performance management concerns, progressive discipline, policy interpretation, and labor laws. BRF’s HR team is cohesive and collaborative and as such, all members must be able to answer basic employee questions and concerns, and when necessary, redirect them to the appropriate team member.
 
WHAT YOU WILL DO 
 
Act as lead on labor and employee relations matters including routine workplace investigations, policy and issue resolution, performance management concerns, employee separations, including all communication to employees, managers, and leadership.
Proactively engage at all levels in the organization to support a 24/7, multi-plant operation, to include regularly working off-shift (early mornings or evenings) to support 2nd and 3rd shifts. Comes onsite off-hours as needed for investigations and incidents.
Collaborates with other HR advisor team members, HRBP, or legal counsel on complex or escalated issues including FMLA, ADA and FLSA issues.
On a weekly basis, will work out of our Williamson facility to provide coverage for HR office and/or for specific meetings with supervisors and employees.
Ensures compliance with federal, state, and local employment laws and regulations, and recommended best practices; reviews policies and practices to maintain compliance.
Participates in team or company-wide projects and initiatives in support of various functional areas across HR to include data management, audits, open enrollment, and others as needed
Collaborates within HR to achieve best results as a team.
Provides backup to other team members in instances of absences.
 
REQUIRED EDUCATION / EXPERIENCE
 
Bachelor’s (B.A./B.S.) in business administration, human resources or related field strongly preferred.
2-4 years of experience in:
Working with and applying employment & labor laws throughout the U.S.
Managing conflict resolution in the workplace, formal training preferred.
Coaching & counseling frontline supervisors.
Ability to analyze data, develop and prepare standard and ad hoc reports, and present findings with conclusions, responses, and recommendations to HR and business leaders.
 
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES
 
 
Ability to exercise sound judgement and make decisions that take into consideration the needs of the business while minimizing risk. 
Effective at balancing multiple priorities, simultaneously, including a high-volume workload and time sensitive issues as they arise; ability to constantly reprioritize.
Outstanding interpersonal skills with ability to confidently interface with a variety of stakeholders, developing and maintaining positive working relationships with all levels of the organization.
Ability to exercise sound judgement and make decisions that takes into consideration the needs of the business while minimizing risk.
Ability to act with uncompromising integrity, professionalism, and cultural awareness
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Critical thinking skills
Customer service skills including exceptional interpersonal, negotiation, and conflict resolution skills
Time management skills with proven ability to meet deadlines
Organizational and prioritization skills
Due to SQF regulations, all employees must be able to fluently read, write, and converse in the English language.
 
At BRF, base pay is one part of our total compensation package, and is determined within a range.  
The base pay range for this role is between 
$70,000 and $78,000 annually
.  Your base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location. 
 
You'll also receive a comprehensive benefits package including low premium and out of pocket cost medical, dental and vision coverage, 401k with company match, generous sick and vacation time, 9 paid holidays, birthday and floating holidays, volunteer time and more!

title: Process Engineer
description:
WHO WE ARE 
Baldwin Richardson
Foods is focused on enriching the flavor of life. As a full-service liquid
products supplier and strategic partner to the food and beverage industry,
Baldwin Richardson Foods combines its formulation expertise and unique
packaging options with robust processing capabilities to produce high-quality
sauces, toppings, syrups, fillings, and shelf-stable beverages for the world's
most iconic Quick Service Restaurants (QSRs), Consumer Packaged Goods (CPG)
brands, and food service companies. Its state-of-the-art Innovation &
Culinary Center transforms trends and culinary inspiration into legendary
products through an award-winning commercialization process. The company also
manufactures and markets Mrs. Richardson's dessert sauces and Nance's
mustards/condiments in addition to producing finished goods for the private
label sector. BRF maintains its headquarters and a manufacturing facility in
Macedon, New York; with a Culinary Innovation Center in Westmont, Illinois; and
offices and manufacturing facilities in Williamson, New York; Pennsauken, New
Jersey; and Corona, California."
  
This role is at our manufacturing facility in Williamson, NY and requires the employee to be onsite.
WHAT WE NEED 
The Process Engineer will use their multidisciplinary engineering knowledge to manage all aspects of assigned commercialization and capital projects, while also supporting, troubleshooting, and improving existing food processing cells and production lines.  This role must successfully manage internal resources, 3rd party contractors, and vendors throughout the project and asset lifecycles.   
WHAT YOU WILL DO
Work effectively with R&D, engineering, maintenance, contractors, and other support teams to design, develop, procure, and implement new technology and/or retrofit existing food processing and production lines.
Create and maintain detailed engineering (block diagrams and P&ID) diagrams, engineering cost analysis, planning project schedules, bid proposals, manage capital budget, contractor activity and safety; working across the organization to ensure impact is identified and communicated. 
For each project, review and analyze packaging, processing lines and utilities within the facility including describing, illustrating, and evaluating systems, identifying limiting components and determining cost and benefits of any change. 
Actively and continuously work with leadership and plant management to identify, evaluate, and assess opportunities for improving production efficiency, sustainability, and quality from an engineering perspective
Individual will lead optimization activities related to capacity, process consistency and cost reduction and provide engineering expertise in scale up and development of new products and processes
Lead major investigations into equipment and/or process failures or inefficiencies; develop and implement corrective action plan and performance improvements, pulling in resources as needed.
Create detailed plans for vertical start up, including standards and performance-based User Requirement Specifications (URS), factory acceptance test (FAT), site acceptance tests (SAT), commissioning, qualification, and verification (CQV).
Advise maintenance and operations personnel on proper operation of systems and serve as a source of expertise in the area of engineering and equipment maintenance for problem analysis and troubleshooting.
Ensures compliance with local, state, and federal codes and regulations related to design, construction, and equipment modification as well as regulations for facility and equipment maintenance. Provide technical expertise during audits.
Be a strong team player and work in cross functional team.
A SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATE WILL HAVE
A minimum of a BS degree in Chemical or Mechanical Engineering (Chemical preferred).
A minimum of three (3) years’ engineering experiencing designing and executing on manufacturing equipment/capital projects.
A minimum of three (3) year experience in Food, and/or Beverage, Personal Care, or other Consumer Packaged Goods (CPG) manufacturing equipment, Pharmaceutical, resulting in a very strong and broad depth of knowledge in process, mechanical, facilities (boilers, chillers, utilities) and packaging equipment. To include:  liquefiers, heat exchangers, kettles, CIP systems, mixers and blenders, and conveyor systems
Vertical startup, Brown Field/ Green Field experience required.
Drafting AutoCAD experience desirable 
At BRF, base pay is
one part of our total compensation package and is determined within a range.
The base pay range for this role is between $105,000 and $115,000K. Your base
pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location. 
 
You'll also receive
a comprehensive benefits package including low premium and out of pocket cost
medical, dental and vision coverage, 401k with company match, generous sick and
vacation time, 9 paid holidays, birthday and floating holidays, volunteer time
and more!

www.brfoods.com
 or

title: Manager Operations Performance (OPM)
description:
WHO WE ARE
  
Baldwin
Richardson Foods is focused on enriching the flavor of life. As a full-service
liquid products supplier and strategic partner to the food and beverage
industry, Baldwin Richardson Foods combines its formulation expertise and
unique packaging options with robust processing capabilities to produce
high-quality sauces, toppings, syrups, fillings, and shelf-stable beverages for
the world's most iconic Quick Service Restaurants (QSRs), Consumer Packaged
Goods (CPG) brands, and food service companies. Its state-of-the-art Innovation
& Culinary Center transforms trends and culinary inspiration into legendary
products through an award-winning commercialization process. The company also
manufactures and markets Mrs. Richardson's dessert sauces and Nance's
mustards/condiments in addition to producing finished goods for the private
label sector. BRF maintains its headquarters and a manufacturing facility in
Macedon, New York; with a Culinary Innovation Center in Westmont, Illinois; and
offices and manufacturing facilities in Williamson, New York; Pennsauken, New
Jersey; and Corona, California.
  
This role works out of our Macedon, NY facility.
 
WHAT WE NEED 
 
BRF’s Operations Performance Manager (OPM) is a hands-on role responsible for driving optimization of assigned production lines and ensuring manufacturing processes align to maintain high quality and efficient production.   The role works cross-functionally with members of operations, maintenance and engineering and relies heavily on Lean Six-Sigma methodologies in problem solving and development of processes.
 
WHAT YOU WILL DO 
 
Area Ownership:
Act as the 24x7 business owner of the assigned value stream by defining standards/expectations, cross-shift teams to drive execution, and developing escalation protocols.
Partner with digital teams to administer digital interfaces for area.
Own value stream KPIs, including data validation, performance reporting, loss analysis, and continuous improvement.
Expertise, Knowledge, and People Development:
Develop expertise in value stream equipment through OEM partnerships. Utilize expertise for higher-level problem-solving.
Develop & maintain Lean and Foundational Elements for the value stream and deploy/support adoption of elements by front line employees.
Engage with OPMs from different plants for best practices to identify improvement opportunities.
Work with R&D and Procurement team for new product trials
Drive/ Support projects to a timely and successful completion and seek additional support from cross functional teams as and when required.
Leadership:
Foster an environment where team members take ownership and feel empowered.
Manage Leads on each shift and support their development as people leaders.
Implement performance management by defining job responsibilities and standards, providing feedback, and addressing issues promptly.
Stay updated on technical knowledge and industry developments.
Coach employees, provide learning opportunities, and offer impactful feedback to foster an effective learning environment.
 
REQUIRED EDUCATION / EXPERIENCE
 
Bachelor’s degree required; Engineering, Science, or Business degrees preferred.
Five (5) years of fast-paced production line process improvement experience and/or management of production/manufacturing processes. 
Two (2) years of direct supervisory experience.
One to two (1-2) years of lean management is preferred with a minimum of lean concepts knowledge.
Proven experience leading and successfully executing continuous improvement activities in a production/manufacturing setting.
 
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES:
 
 
Strong interpersonal skills and team orientation; technical and problem-solving skills.
Demonstrated leadership and change management skills.
Ability to work cross-functionally between departments and divisions.
Ability to deal with and manage conflict while building successful business relationships across a range of stakeholder groups, both internal and external, to the organization
Ability to define, extract, evaluate, and utilize data for process improvement from applicable systems.
Flexibility and availability to work rotating shifts, overtime, and weekends in emergencies.
Due to SQF regulations, all employees must be able to fluently read, write, and converse in the English language.

one part of our total compensation package and is determined within a range.
The base pay range for this role is between $90,000K and $110,000K annually. Your base
pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location. 
 
You'll also receive
a comprehensive benefits package including low premium and out of pocket cost
medical, dental and vision coverage, 401k with company match, generous sick and
vacation time, 9 paid holidays, birthday and floating holidays, volunteer time
and more!

What does a Mortgage Loan Originator do?
 
Responsible for continuously soliciting, negotiating, underwriting, and coordinating the closing of residential mortgage loans in compliance with CNB Mortgage Company’s lending policies and procedures; promoting business for CNB Mortgage Company by maintaining good customer relations through referrals from existing customers and marketing for new clients;   assisting in attaining established corporate, region and branch goals through active participation in new and existing products and sales programs; coordinating work within the division, as well as with other divisions and departments; complying with operating policies and procedures established for the mortgage loan function; communicating with appropriate personnel; responding to inquiries or requests for information; maintaining appropriate records Responsible for continuously soliciting, negotiating, underwriting, and coordinating the closing of residential mortgage loans in compliance with CNB Mortgage Company’s lending policies and procedures; promoting business for CNB Mortgage Company by maintaining good customer relations through referrals from existing customers and marketing for new clients;   assisting in attaining established corporate, region and branch goals through active participation in new and existing products and sales programs; coordinating work within the division, as well as with other divisions and departments; complying with operating policies and procedures established for the mortgage loan function; communicating with appropriate personnel; responding to inquiries or requests for information; maintaining appropriate records and providing assigned reports.
What is needed to be successful in this role?

A minimum of two (2) years’ experience in related position required;
Knowledge of all lending activities and terminology; 
basic knowledge of commercial, construction, real estate, and consumer loan processing;
A thorough knowledge of all bank regulatory requirements 
What 
are general duties
?
Continuously solicits, negotiates, underwrites, and coordinates the closing of residential mortgage loans in compliance with CNB Mortgage Company’s lending policies and procedures as follows:
Engages in business development activities and solicitation of new business; actively involved in instilling and maintaining a positive sales environment through education of CNB Mortgage Company’s products and services.
Interviews prospective applicants and requests specified information related to loan or credit application; corresponds or re-interviews applicants to resolve questions regarding application information.
Performs prequalification assessment and analysis of financial condition and risk of financing requests within framework of CNB Mortgage Company’s guidelines and industry trends.
Gathers and analyzes all information necessary to present a loan request for approval; meets with existing or potential customers; negotiates loan terms and conditions; pre-approves loans through Automated Underwriting Systems.
Ensures loans are processed according to agreement, customer needs and conform to CNB Mortgage Company lending policies; obtains sufficient information and/or documentation from customers; solves problems relative to processing and servicing of loans within his or her book of business.
Ensures that credit inquiries are researched to determine credit worthiness and appropriate collateral positioning are achieved.
Reinforces the application of superior customer service through his or her own example along with appropriate follow through with involved customers and employees.
Consistently applies good decision-making techniques pertaining to inquiries, approvals, requests as they apply to existing policies and procedures, keeping within assigned approval parameters and using these instances as learning tools for employee development.
What makes working at CNB different?
 
At CNB, we are 
Investing in You
.  Our strong corporate culture is based upon seven Core Values: Honesty and Integrity, Responsibility, Teamwork, Respect, Innovation, Professionalism, and Commitment. Our culture nurtures passionate employees and offers great rewards including:

description:

Canandaigua National Bank & Trust

What does a Bank Operations Representative I do?
 
A Bank Operations Representative I is an elite financial industry professional with expertise in bank operations function processing. This role plays a crucial part in the bank's mission to provide an exceptional customer experience by researching and resolving the department’s processes and issues and supporting customer facing personnel with questions associated with Bank operations processes. Processes wire transfers to Fed and provides quality control on wires, verifying all information is correctly entered.

title: Client Service Associate
description:
Cobblestone Capital Advisors, LLC is a privately owned, Rochester‐based, SEC registered, investment advisor offering comprehensive investment advisory and wealth management services. The firm manages over $2.6 billion in assets and has experienced steady growth since its founding in 1986.
 
Job Summary
A Client Service Associate (CSA) will work closely with relationship managers, portfolio managers, wealth planners, private investments team members, and the back-office operations team to ensure high-quality service for Cobblestone’s clients. This position requires a positive professional attitude, strong computer skills, attention to detail, and the ability to work in a team environment. Our team approach to client service is a strength of Cobblestone and we are looking for the right candidate to thrive in our collaborative and supportive team environment. We place a strong emphasis on being professional, pleasant, and courteous to our clients and to each other.
 
Duties and Responsibilities
Ensure that all client needs and requests are handled promptly, accurately, and professionally.
Responsible for accurately handling all aspects of the client account opening process - 
custodial paperwork, portfolio accounting and CRM system set up, asset transfers, and client communication.
Monitor and research all money movement activity in and out of client accounts on a daily basis.
Handle routine client requests for distributions, name and address changes, gift processing, bill payments, account information, etc.
Create client presentations/communications through collaboration with portfolio managers, planners, private investments, and the back-office operations team.
Maintain customer relationship management (CRM) system and ensure the accuracy of tasks, notes, and records.
Responsible for answering phone lines and ensuring calls are routed properly.
Coordinate client communications and be a supportive part of the client service process.
Contribute positively to the team and firm culture by offering your help and/or time whenever possible.
Handle ad hoc projects as assigned.
Continue to develop technical knowledge and expertise.
Guide others through your behavior – ‘leading by example’ within the team and across the firm.
Identify and evaluate daily workflows for process improvement opportunities and work with Manager to enact change.
 
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university (or) Associates degree and prior financial services experience.
Two or more years of industry experience preferred.
A friendly professional demeanor and ability to excel in a team-oriented environment.
Systems and process-oriented mindset.
Strong proficiency with Microsoft Office suite especially Excel, Word, PowerPoint.
Excellent communication and organizational skills.
Salesforce experience a plus.
Ability to manage time effectively, set priorities and meet deadlines.
Strong analytical and detail-oriented aptitude; a high degree of accuracy is required.
Notary public designation or ability to achieve within 6 months.
Ability to learn and adapt to change.
Willingness to seek out new learning opportunities to increase your effectiveness in your assigned position.
 
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and our company’s policies and practices relating to recruitment, employment, career development and advancement, promotion and retirement are based solely on merit, without regard to all legally protected classes, including but not limited to: race, color, sex, age, disability, religion,  citizenship or immigration status, national origin, ancestry, military status or veteran status, marital status, familial status, sexual orientation, domestic violence victim status, predisposing genetic characteristics and genetic information, and any other status protected by law.

title: Operations Generalist
description:
Cobblestone Capital Advisors, LLC is a privately‐owned, Rochester‐based, SEC registered, investment advisor offering comprehensive investment advisory and wealth management services. The firm manages over $2.6 billion in assets and has experienced steady growth since its founding in 1986.
 
Job Summary
We are seeking an enthusiastic candidate to join our firm as an Operations Generalist. This entry-level role will be an integral part of the firm, as the Operations Generalist will be responsible for supporting team members across the entire organization as well as providing the highest quality of service to our clients. The Operations Generalist will cross-train with various departments to be ready to assist with not only day-to-day tasks but ongoing special projects.
 
Duties and Responsibilities
Support client teams in the execution of client-related work – CSA, Planning, Private Investments, etc.
Ensure that all client needs and requests are handled promptly, accurately, and professionally
Learn and become able to interface independently with our primary portfolio accounting and CRM systems
Maintain customer relationship management (CRM) system and ensure accuracy of Tasks, Cases, and Records
Maintain and administer all aspects of the quarterly reporting process
Perform administrative duties: filing, mailing, scanning, photocopying, binding, faxing, stocking supplies, etc.
Work as part of a team to answer phone lines and ensure calls are routed to proper person
Communicate and collaborate with team members regarding accounts and processes
Provide back-up support across various departments when needed
Provide primary back-up support for the Receptionist and front desk responsibilities
Learn and assist with back-office Ops tasks including but not limited to: proxy voting, claim litigation, account reconciliation, and billing
Become an expert in our CRM system to assist with firm wide process development and training
Continue to develop technical knowledge and expertise
Identify and evaluate daily workflows for process improvement opportunities and work with others to enact change
Perform other job-related duties or special projects as assigned
 
Qualifications
 
Bachelor’s degree
Confident and friendly professional demeanor
Excellent communication and organizational skills
Solid computer skills including capacity to learn new programs quickly
Strong proficiency with Microsoft Office suite especially Excel, Word, PowerPoint
Ability to excel in a team-oriented environment
Salesforce knowledge a plus or the ability to become proficient quickly
Systems and process-oriented mindset
Ability to manage time effectively, set priorities and meet deadlines
Strong attention to detail; a high degree of accuracy is required
Ability to learn and adapt to change
Willingness to seek out new learning opportunities to increase your effectiveness in your assigned position
 
Compensation and Benefits
Pay/Benefits are competitive based on industry standards and experience; the anticipated base salary range is $40,000 to $50,000 but may be adjusted commensurate with candidate experience and qualifications.
Performance Bonus
Benefits include health care, paid vacation, 401(K)
No phone calls, please.
