title: Pricing Execution Manager
description:
Job Description
Company Summary
We’re the producers, creators and marketers of beer, wine and spirits brands that people love. At Constellation Brands, we’re driven to push boundaries and think beyond today to deliver products and experiences that resonate now, tomorrow and well into the future. Because of this approach, we’re the fastest-growing large CPG company in the U.S. at retail, with operations in the U.S., Mexico, New Zealand and Italy. Our premium portfolio of iconic brands like Corona Extra, Modelo Especial, Kim Crawford, Robert Mondavi, Meiomi, The Prisoner, SVEDKA Vodka, High West Whiskey, and more drive industry-leading growth for us today. But we’re just getting started. Our ability to stay on the forefront of consumer trends has fueled our success since our founding in 1945 and will guide us in creating the next generation of products and experiences Worth Reaching For.
Position Summary
This position will operate in a matrix environment, supporting cross functional teams, and requiring a high level of collaboration with multiple business partners (Revenue Management, Finance, Sales). Requires advanced MS Excel competency, ability to synthesize syndicated data, attention to detail, strong pricing acumen, an aptitude with quantitative analysis, and ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment. Experience in communicating pricing concepts to non-pricing business owners from all levels through verbal, written and presentation skills.
Responsibilities
Manage and coordinate all price and promotion changes
Coordinate implementation of annual price increases and communicate to stakeholders
Identify pricing opportunities and develop recommendations to improve price realization and profitability
Support implementation of Revenue Management initiatives, pricing strategies and monitor compliance to guardrails
Complete regular and ad hoc pricing requests/analyses to support fact based decision-making process
Own the management of pricing in pricing software including submitting changes and preparing audits as needed to ensure accuracy.
Manage Price Promotion Management (PPM) variances with distributors to ensure accrual and payment accuracy.
Work closely with region Finance to recognize P&L risk and opportunities through pricing activities
Educate business partners on pricing acumen and concepts including applicable alcohol beverage laws and price elasticities
Support AOP development by providing pricing related impact (rates and volume) 
Participate in price training, development opportunities, and activities related to the Revenue Management function.
Required Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Economics, Statistics or related field
5-8 years of work experience in pricing related positions in Alcohol Beverage or CPG Industry 
Requires ability to work independently with minimal guidance.  To lead projects and ensure successful completion from start to finish.
Strong data analysis capabilities required, including Advanced Excel skills (knowledge of data formatting and formulas, filters, pivot tables, macros, etc.).
Solid knowledge/experience with syndicated market data (Nielsen, IRI)
Must demonstrate consistent attention to detail & commitment to accuracy 
Highly motivated, results oriented individual who excels in dynamic environment. 
Excellent time management, project planning, and organizational skills.
  
Excellent communication skills – verbal, written and presentation.
Must be proactive, self-starter, capable of adapting to rapidly changing priorities & performing in fast-paced environment
ADA Physical/Mental/Workplace Requirements
Must be at least 21 years of age. Must be able to sit and/or stand for long periods of time and work on a computer for extended periods. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Chicago, Illinois
Additional Locations
Virtual - US

Job Area
Finance & Accounting

title: Accountant, Senior
description:
Job Description
Position Summary
:  
Under minimal supervision, the Senior Accountant works to ensure the completeness and accuracy of all transactions in the general ledger in accordance with U.S. GAAP. This includes all activities related to the global accounting function: close procedures, preparation, review and analysis, maintaining a strong control environment and other activities necessary to support consolidated financial statements.
Responsibilities
:
Responsible for preparation and review of monthly accounting close procedures to ensure compliance with U.S. GAAP and internal controls, as well as the accuracy of financial statements. Specific month-end close activities include:
Preparation and review of journal entries for operating companies, as well as consolidation and elimination entries
Record, analyze and review inter- and intra- company transactions 
Review of trial balances and monthly trends; perform additional review as needed to support the close
Analysis and review of operating company financial statements, both foreign and domestic
Preparation and review of monthly U.S. GAAP financial statements including, balance sheet, income statement and cash flow
Preparation and review of high-quality balance sheet account reconciliations
Support a sustainable and efficient close and reporting process with a continuous improvement mindset.
Preparation of quarterly external reporting deliverables and support of internal and external audit requirements.
Required Qualifications:
Minimum 3 years of experience in public accounting and/or relevant industry experience (combination preferred)
Bachelor’s degree in Accounting or equivalent required
CPA certification or equivalent strongly preferred
Proficiency in Excel required; experience with SAP, BPC, and Blackline a plus
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
ADA Physical/Mental/Workplace Requirements
Occasional lifting up to 25 lbs.
Sitting, working at desk/personal computer for extended periods of time
Ability to travel domestically and internationally

title: Fixed Assets Administrator
description:
Job Description
About Us
Only candidates with the right to work in New Zealand will be considered for this role. Please proceed to application if you hold a current work visa or citizenship/passport.
Constellation Brands New Zealand and Australia (CBNZA) is an award-winning grower, producer and distributor of globally recognised wine brands including New Zealand’s own Kim Crawford, Selaks and Tipping Point. CBNZA is known for its innovation and collaboration and ‘putting people first’ 
philosophy
. CBNZA features a highly skilled team of experts located both locally and around the world and is a division of Constellation Brands Inc which is headquartered in up-state New York in the USA.
About the Role /Key Responsibilities 
To provide administration of the capital and fixed asset function. To ensure that financial planning, reporting, forecasting and analysis is accurate and timely and meets the needs of the of the business
About you 
We are seeking a process-oriented individual to administer our capital expenditure and fixed asset accounting. Experience from CA firms or business administration in managing fixed assets is preferred. The ideal candidate is a people person who excels at building and maintaining relationships and is capable of providing constructive feedback and challenging ideas when necessary.
Fixed assets and purchase order experience in a finance department, including completing reconciliations, checklists and reporting.
Enjoys engaging with various business departments, clearly communicating requirements and gaining their support
Intermediate Excel skills
Organised and efficient with effective time management skills
Curious and eager to learn, capable of identifying potential issues.
Benefits & Culture
At Constellation Brands we believe people are our greatest asset, therefore we provide benefits to our employees and work hard on creating a culture of inclusion and diversity. A taster of some of our exceptional benefits include a flexible working environment, birthday leave, extensive training and development opportunities, and a wellness subsidy - because we believe healthy employees are happy employees - and a generous brand ambassador allowance so you can sample some of the best wine on the market!
Constellation Brands is a member of Diversity Works New Zealand. We are committed to diversity and inclusion. We value and encourage participation of all applicants regardless of their background. 
If you’re interested, apply now via the relevant link. For more information about us, visit 
www.constellationnz.com/careers
Applications will be reviewed as they are received and if a suitable candidate is found, the company reserves the right to appoint the candidate prior to the advertising closing.

title: Manager, Payroll
description:
Job Description
Company Summary
 
We’re the producers, creators and marketers of beer, wine and spirits brands that people love. At Constellation Brands, we’re driven to push boundaries and think beyond today to deliver products and experiences that resonate now, tomorrow and well into the future. Because of this approach, we’re the fastest-growing large CPG company in the U.S. at retail, with operations in the U.S., Mexico, New Zealand and Italy. Our premium portfolio of iconic brands like Corona Extra, Modelo Especial, Kim Crawford, Robert Mondavi, Meiomi, The Prisoner, SVEDKA Vodka, High West Whiskey, and more drive industry-leading growth for us today. But we’re just getting started. Our ability to stay on the forefront of consumer trends has fueled our success since our founding in 1945 and will guide us in creating the next generation of products and experiences Worth Reaching For.
 
Position Summary
:  Responsible for the development of the Payroll processing team within the Global Business Services organization. Oversight of activities related to the payroll tax compliance, payroll accounting, and payroll processing for all U.S., International and Canadian employees. Provides supervision and development of approximately 4 staff – exempt and nonexempt.
Responsibilities: 
General Payroll Responsibilities 
Liaise with the Team Lead, Payroll Processing to support payroll calculation and processing activities as it relates to overall payroll activities
Ensure compliance with all payroll tax laws, regulations and deductions
Ensure accurate and timely completion of normal cycle payroll, reconciliations and audit activities
Oversee Processing of International payrolls for Germany, Netherlands, Hong Kong, Shanghai, Switzerland, and Barbados
Oversee processing and reconciling of expatriate shadow entries, as it’s a more complex payroll tax item
Perform, assist and/or oversee additional ad-hoc general payroll responsibilities in support of the end-to-end payroll process such as completion of tax processing, amendments, and remittances, unclaimed property, and cash flow forecasting.
Review all payroll related journal entries in SAP
Review all reconciliations in Blackline, and determine accrual adjustments as required
Oversee Daily processing of cash funding activities related to net pays, taxes, and 401k
Recommend process improvements and control procedures including continuous documentation of processes and controls
Oversee the Review and audit of G/L mapping and Integrations between Workday and SAP and make updates where and when necessary
Develop and maintain process documentation, policies and procedures related to all aspects of Payroll tax and accounting processing.
Assist in the maintenance of controls over accounting systems and records maintenance involved in the payroll function to ensure compliance with Sarbanes-Oxley and document retention policies
Support all Payroll responsibilities required for period close, including G/L postings and reconciliations as required
Support and assist with the resolution of payroll tax and accounting inquiries
 
Period End Support
Prepare Payroll reporting, investigation and resolution as required , including 401K true-up, profit sharing, eligible earnings, and bonus eligible earnings reporting and analysis
Provide both internal and external audit support
Assist with preparation of ongoing tax reporting requirements (monthly, quarterly and annual)
 
Metrics and Service Level Agreements (SLAs) 
Responsible for meeting department requirements as defined in the Service Level Agreements (SLA’s)
Assist with relationship management as liaison to HR, Comp/Benefits teams, Accounting/Finance as needed
Support customer service initiatives
Support and assist with continuous improvement of the Payroll Services Team 
Required Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, Business Administration or equivalent required
CPP and/or CPA certification strongly preferred
Advanced proficiency in MS Excel is mandatory
3-5 years of experience in relevant payroll experience with supervisory experience required; Canadian and Multi-State payroll experience preferred
Proven problem solving skills and ability to make decisions
Proficiency with personal computers and associated word processing, spreadsheet, presentation and database software; experience with SAP and Workday preferred
Excellent communication skills required (both verbal and written)
Ability to travel 0-10%
 
Core Competencies to be Successful:
Initiative and results oriented
Flexibility to adapt to new systems/processes
Strong attention to detail
Ability to work on simultaneous projects at the same time
Analytic and research oriented
Demonstrated business acumen
Strategic thinking
Ability to build productive relationships
Strong people skills
Proficiency in planning, prioritization and project management

Canandaigua, New York

Rochester, New York

Finance & Accounting

title: Senior Analyst, Corporate Development
description:
Job Description
Company Summary 
We’re the producers, creators and marketers of beer, wine and spirits brands that people love. At Constellation Brands, we’re driven to push boundaries and think beyond today to deliver products and experiences that resonate now, tomorrow and well into the future. Because of this approach, we’re the fastest-growing large CPG company in the U.S. at retail, with operations in the U.S., Mexico, New Zealand and Italy. Our premium portfolio of iconic brands like Corona Extra, Modelo Especial, Kim Crawford, Robert Mondavi, Meiomi, The Prisoner, SVEDKA Vodka, High West Whiskey, and more drive industry-leading growth for us today. But we’re just getting started. Our ability to stay on the forefront of consumer trends has fueled our success since our founding in 1945 and will guide us in creating the next generation of products and experiences Worth Reaching For.
Position Summary
Process owner of financial / valuation modeling as part of the Corporate Development function, which includes:
Creating complex, flexible financial models for use in assessing Mergers and Acquisitions
Managing the collection and organization of relevant project data from various corporate, divisional personnel
Interacting with external parties regarding Corporate Development activities including business case assumptions and outputs, valuation sensitivities and information requirements
Lead acquisition related due-diligence 
Project manage all acquisition related integration activities
Continuously evaluate industry trends and competitive landscape for purposes of target identification
Lead other high-profile, strategic projects as required – e.g., footprint optimization, large scale capital expansion, asset divestitures, partnerships, minority investments, etc.
Develop strong relationships across operating companies and central support functions
Work closely with internal leadership as the company undertakes new initiatives (mergers, acquisitions, strategic projects) to ensure effective and efficient execution of operational objectives
Act as a trusted internal partner for rapid, complex analysis supporting business decisions
Prepare executive management and board level presentations summarizing findings and recommendations
Other Corporate Development related duties and special projects as required
Requirements
MBA or equivalent experience preferred
3 to 5 years’ experience in a finance or business analysis role
Very strong analytical skills and business acumen – ability to rapidly come up to speed on new issues and identify the critical questions to be addressed
Excellent project management skills – ability to structure a complex issue and rapidly identify and test hypotheses
Strong communications skills and ability to communicate and influence all levels in the organization including a broad base of finance and business partners
Sufficient influence to effectively resolve issues and ensure business and resource commitment
Demonstrated ability in leading / managing projects (with other functional areas, peers) and direct reports
Very strong people management skills – ability to lead and develop a team
Comfort working through ambiguity and in a rapidly changing environment
Experience with a large consumer product company
Strong spreadsheet proficiency and analytical skills
Ability to interpret data and analyze findings
Project management experience
Excellent communication skills required (both verbal and written)
Experience with business valuation analyses, M&A transactions and strategic projects such as competitor analysis, business model analysis, product/market fit, a plus 
Location
Rochester, New York
Additional Locations

title: Accounting Administrator
description:
Job Description
About Us
Constellation Brands New Zealand and Australia (CBNZA) is an award-winning grower, producer and distributor of globally recognised wine brands including New Zealand’s own Kim Crawford, Selaks and Tipping Point. CBNZA is known for its innovation and collaboration and ‘putting people first’ 
philosophy
. CBNZA features a highly skilled team of experts located both locally and around the world and is a division of Constellation Brands Inc which is headquartered in up-state New York in the USA.
About the Role /Key Responsibilities 
Only candidates with the right to work in New Zealand will be considered for this role. Please proceed to application if you hold a current work visa or citizenship/passport. 
As part of CBNZ's Accounting team, this role supports both the finance and transaction teams. Reporting to the Senior Financial Accountant, some of your key responsibilities will include:
Purchase Orders
Bank Reconciliation
Cashflow management
Banking and Credit Card Administration
Grower Payments coordination
Reporting as required
Secondary support role for invoice processing, PO process, Master Data maintenance and update, GRIR, FX Revaluation, Accounts Receivable, Credit Control, and reporting, etc.
Support process improvement initiatives, for example, PO and Supplier Master Data procedures, AR Receipting and Reporting, etc.
About you 
The ideal candidate is working towards a tertiary qualification, preferably in business, Finance, or Accounting, with a minimum of 2 years of accounts experience. They possess good knowledge of relevant accounting frameworks and advanced MS Office skills, particularly in Excel. Attention to detail, numerical proficiency, and problem-solving abilities are key, along with effective communication skills. Completion of a bachelor’s degree, Familiarity with SAP Cloud or similar systems and FMCG industry experience are preferred. If you are deadline-driven, committed to quality, embracing continuous improvement, and are an adaptable team player, apply now!
Benefits & Culture
At Constellation Brands we believe people are our greatest asset, therefore we provide benefits to our employees and work hard on creating a culture of inclusion and diversity. A taster of some of our exceptional benefits include a flexible working environment, birthday leave, extensive training and development opportunities, and a wellness subsidy - because we believe healthy employees are happy employees - and a generous brand ambassador allowance so you can sample some of the best wine on the market!
Constellation Brands is a member of Diversity Works New Zealand. We are committed to diversity and inclusion. We value and encourage participation of all applicants regardless of their background. 
If you’re interested, apply now via the relevant link ! For more information about us, visit 
www.constellationnz.com/careers
Applications will be reviewed as they are received and if a suitable candidate is found, the company reserves the right to appoint the candidate prior to the advertising closing.
Location
Auckland Office
Additional Locations

Full time
Job Area
Finance & Accounting

title: Product Cost Engineer
description:
It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they're doing!
We're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business.
Creation Technologies is a contract electronics manufacturer.  Our business spans four countries with many hundreds of customers.  We are seeking a talented and driven professional to join our Product Cost Engineering team. The Quote Coordinator is responsible for coordinating customer requests and assembling material, labor, and equipment costs to generate estimates for customers. This position includes collaborating with multiple departments, including Sales, Program management, Engineering, Purchasing, and Finance.
Responsibilities
Collaborate with internal customers and stakeholders to define the scope of each quote including regulatory and testing requirements, assembly drawings, BOMs, and approved manufacturer information.
Assemble quotes that include complete BOMs, setup, assembly, and testing operations, material costs, labor times, and NRE/tooling costs.
Prepare documentation that identifies each cost element, indicating sources of data, assumptions used, and notes to the customer.
Utilize ERP and quote management systems to access and update information such as quotes, tasks, part data, labor history, purchasing orders, and vendor contacts.
Ensure all expected costs have been clearly defined for interdepartmental quote review and approval.
Facilitate clear communication with the larger quoting team to meet deadlines, troubleshoot issues, and drive continuous improvement.
Complete additional tasks as assigned (candidate dependent) such as supplier negotiation, commodity analysis and training support.
Qualifications & Skills
Requirements
3-5 years’ experience in the wire and cable assembly manufacturing, quoting, or similar.
Strong research capabilities given vague or incomplete specifications.
Excellent task management, and organization skills.
Customer service driven with strong verbal and written communication skills.
Effectively prioritize multiple, fluid deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
Moderate to advanced proficiency with Microsoft Office, especially in Excel.
Assets
Experience with material costing tools, such as QuoteWin.
Experience in material procurement, sourcing, cost estimating, or a relevant mix of experience and post-secondary education.
Familiarity with database applications (i.e., Epicor, Salesforce).
Expertise in advanced Excel functions (i.e., array functions) and VBA programming.
In compliance with pay transparency requirements, the anticipated starting pay for new hires for this position is between $64k-$85k per year. Full-time employees are also eligible for performance-based bonuses and benefits.  This is not a guarantee of compensation or salary, as a final offer amount may vary based on factors including but not limited to experience, education, location, and shift.  
If you like wild growth and working with happy, enthusiastic over-achievers, you'll enjoy your career with us!
Creation Technologies is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Title for the position will be in accordance with applicable national and local laws.

title: Director, Financial Planning and Analysis
description:
It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they're doing!
We're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business.
Manager for our Rochester business unit will lead monthly financial reviews, forecasting, and annual operating plans across the organization, interacting across the Creation Technologies matrix to effectively communicate financial results and opportunities. This role will partner with a team of highly skilled professionals across the site and functional teams and will support and influence the finance organization to drive efficient processes, generate valuable insights and produce effective communication.
This candidate will be intellectually curious with high energy and have a passion to make the company successful.  He/she will have the mentality to think like the owner of the business and take a proactive yet collaborative approach to accomplishing business goals. This position reports directly into the Sr. Director, Financial Planning and Analysis, with a strong dotted line to the Vice President, General Manager, Rochester facility.  The role will be based at our site Rochester, NY, location.
Specific Responsibilities
Manage the business unit, monthly financial review process, including coordinating activities across manufacturing operations developing a thorough understanding of the results (P&L, Balance Sheet, and Free Cash Flow) and providing insights on future trends.
Clearly communicate a cohesive and concise story around business drivers and potential implications on future results.
Serve as an objective financial steward and a trusted business partner who enables effective decision making that identifies opportunities to drive revenue growth, margin improvement and cost savings.
Develop financial forecasts and support long-range planning processes.
Provide support to business unit team in matters of cost, budget and inventory control including preparing analytics impacting materials and labor to influence manufacturing operational process improvements.
Analyze cycle count and physical inventory results.
Partner with other finance disciplines to enable business performance: controllership, transformation and integration, analytics, systems, and continuous improvement.
Skills and Competencies
10+ years of relevant financial experience and partnership with business leadership
Experience in a global manufacturing and supply chain environment. Standard costing environment preferred.
Strong influence management skills with a continuous improvement mindset.
Detailed understanding of financial budgeting and forecasting concepts and modeling.
A team player who is collaborative and receptive to ideas from others and works effectively across functions to identify and resolve critical issues.
Proven ability to work well under pressure and maintain a positive, enthusiastic attitude.
A creative, yet pragmatic, problem solver who is hands-on as well as detail oriented.
Excellent planning, execution, and project-management skills.
Experience working with a SaaS CPM Solution such as Adaptive Planning, Planful (Host Analytics), Hyperion, etc.  Oracle experience is a plus.
Excellent skills in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint.
Education
The 
Director, Financial Planning & Analysis Manager 
for our
 Rochester 
business unit team must have a bachelor’s degree with 10+ years of work experience in Finance and/or Accounting.
Other ad hoc requests as required.
Additional Requirements:
Pursuant to ITAR, EAR, and other export compliance laws and regulations, applicants for this position must be U.S. Persons as defined by U.S. law, i.e., U.S. citizens, lawful permanent residents ('Green Card' holders), persons granted refugee status or asylum status in the United States, or temporary residents granted amnesty.
In compliance with pay transparency requirements, the anticipated starting pay for new hires for this position is between $165,000-$190,000 per year. a shift differential may also be provided depending on the work hours.  Full-time employees are also eligible for performance-based bonuses and benefits.  This is not a guarantee of compensation or salary, as a final offer amount may vary based on factors including but not limited to experience, education, location, and shift.  
If you like wild growth and working with happy, enthusiastic over-achievers, you'll enjoy your career with us!
Creation Technologies is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. title: Senior Cost Accountant
description:
It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they're doing!
We're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business.
Creation Technologies is a high complex, low volume electronics contract manufacturing company with 14 operating locations across Canada, the U.S., Mexico and China.  
Reporting to the Regional Accounting Leader, the Senior Cost Accountant is responsible any manufacturing and costing related activities within the business unit. This position also works with the rest of the accounting team across the enterprise in acquisition integration, system implementation, process and reporting standardization, and control review and enhancement to ensure that we continue to provide high quality and accurate reporting in the very efficient and effective way while safeguard the company’s asset. The successful candidate is someone who has in-depth knowledge and experience in manufacturing costing, financial reporting under IFRS, and can tailor its communication depending on the topic and audience.
Responsibilities 
Managing manufacturing accounting and costing
Prepare detailed weekly/monthly management reports and working files for operations, with an emphasis on manufacturing job costing, standard cost, and variance analysis (job close variance, purchase price variance, invoice price variance, labor variance, etc) 
Compile and analyze financial information for ledger entries and business transaction documentation 
Conduct monthly financial close, reporting, and general ledger reconciliations, ensuring accuracy in cost-related entries 
Implement and refine accounting and internal controls, with a particular focus on manufacturing and costing processes 
Maintain and optimize the Chart of Accounts and financial reporting structure to reflect manufacturing cost considerations accurately 
Analyze, interpret, and explain results to budget, forecast, and standard cost 
Engage with internal and external auditors, providing expert insights into control and process deficiencies and recommendations for improvements 
Other duties assigned 
Personal Characteristics 
Demonstrated ability to build strong and trusting relationships with managers, employees and peers 
Advanced communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to present complex information in an easily understood manner tailoring the communication to diverse audiences to facilitate understanding 
Exceptional time management and multi-tasking skills with the ability to prioritize tasks and work within established deadlines and time constraints 
Demonstrated ability to act on own initiative and exercise professional judgment  
Ability to work with a high degree of accuracy and attention to detail 
Self-motivated, work independently, as well as being part of a team 
Exceptional interpersonal and motivational skills 
Excellent problem solving and analytical thinking/innovation 
Experience 
Good working knowledge of IFRS  
Minimum 5 years of accounting experience within a dynamic manufacturing environment 
Minimum 2 years of dedicated cost accounting experience, especially in manufacturing job costing, standard cost, and variance analysis 
Demonstrated ability to partner effectively with senior business leaders, with a comprehensive understanding of manufacturing operations 
Advanced analytical and financial modeling skills, with a strong ability to measure and communicate financial performance, particularly in manufacturing cost analysis 
Proven track record as a key member of a high-performance accounting team in a manufacturing setting 
Experience with Tier1 ERP systems (Oracle, SAP) is preferred 
Qualifications & Skills 
Bachelor’s degree, Accounting/Business major is preferable  
Professional accounting designation (CPA or equivalent) 
Equivalent combination of education and/or experience will be considered 
In compliance with pay transparency requirements, the anticipated starting pay for new hires for this position is between USD $90k-$105k per year. Full-time employees are also eligible for performance-based bonuses and benefits.  This is not a guarantee of compensation or salary, as a final offer amount may vary based on factors including but not limited to experience, education, location, and shift.  
If you like wild growth and working with happy, enthusiastic over-achievers, you'll enjoy your career with us!
We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other characteristic protected by law.
Canada: 
Title for the position will be in accordance with applicable national and local laws.

title: Industrial Cleaner
description:
JOB SUMMARY
As an Industrial Cleaner, you will maintain the cleanliness of the production zones (packaging and brewing) for the FIFCO USA campus to ensure a clean and safe working environment is upheld.  
 
STATUS: 
Full Time
LOCATION:
 Rochester, NY
DEPARTMENT: 
Sanitation
SHIFT: 
Off-Shift / Weekends and Overtime as needed
JOB TYPE:
 Union
 
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS & RESPONSIBILITIES
Safely clean non-product contact equipment and surfaces including, but not limited to: walls, drains, overhead pipes, hoses, and other items outlined as requested
Perform CIP and foaming procedures for pasteurizers and wet area packaging conveyors as per master sanitation schedule
Safely operate cleaning equipment such as floor scrubbers, pressure washer, stripping/waxing equipment, snow blower, man-lift, and other outlined equipment as the job permits
Remove snow from walking areas and apply ice melt as outlined in addition to sweeping outside areas when needed
Safely perform hazardous waste handling as outlined
Mix and titrate Industrial Cleaning chemicals accurately and safely
Identify and correct potential micro-biological hazards 
Complete work orders and preventative maintenance items as outlined
Work with management on updates to Master Sanitation Schedule, documents, chemical suppliers, chemical usage, and other materials used to perform Industrial Cleaning functions 
Properly complete required paperwork as outlined for the job
Utilize step stools, ladders, and/or elevated platforms as outlined for the job 
Utilize forklifts/scissor lifts to move required items as outlined for the job
Utilize PPE as required
Perform duties as assigned by management 
Actively exhibit a commitment to support a diverse and inclusive work environment
 
EDUCATION, SKILLS & EXPERIENCE
High School Diploma or equivalent 
Forklift certification preferred
Ability to read, write, and interpret documents in English such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals
Ability to apply concepts such as additions, fractions, and percentages for chemical usage
Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions
 
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS & ENVIRONMENTAL CONDITIONS
Must be able to lift and/or move up to 50 lbs. 
Must be able to regularly use hands, work outside in all seasons, and use heavy equipment 
Must be able to frequently bend and climb as well as duck under conveyors and equipment
Must be able to work in confined spaces as well as from tall heights 
Must be able to work with moving mechanical parts and loud noise levels
Must be able to work with hazardous chemicals
Specific vision abilities include close vision and ability to adjust focus
 
PERKS
Generous Benefits with options to fit your life
Blue4U Discounts
Retirement Options with employer contributions
10 paid holidays per year
Gainsharing Bonuses
Union Support
Tools and tool replacement options
Culture of pride and community involvement
And of course, beer! 
 
Pay Rate: $18.32/hr

title: Talent Acquisition Lead (Remote)
description:
JOB SUMMARY
 
The Talent Acquisition Lead partners with the VP of Talent and the HRBP’s to create and ensure the correct execution of FIFCO USA Talent Acquisition strategy, including implementation and follow-through of end-to-end Talent Acquisition processes. The TA Lead will work cross-functionally with Talent Operations, HRBPs, and other departments to manage and plan for open headcount.

Own, implement, and update all TA related activities

Analyze workforce planning and recruiting best practices for all divisions of the company
Build long term strategic partnerships with external vendors to build upon existing TA capabilities 
Partner with local colleges, trade schools, and 3
rd
 party services to create contingency plans for recruitment needs as they arise

Excellent verbal and written communication skills

Previous experience in building employer brands preferred

title: Forklift Operator
description:
JOB SUMMARY
As a Forklift Operator on our warehouse team, you will be responsible for the safe movement of materials and products in multiple onsite warehouses and one offsite warehouse. To track inventory movements throughout your shift, you will use a handheld scanner and work directly with warehouse leadership to ensure accuracy and that customers’ needs are met.

Safely operate a single and double forklift in a production/warehouse environment.
Use of scan gun technology to control inventory movements.
Load and unload multiple trailers per shift.
Move palletized goods within a warehouse.
Shrink-wrap pallets and handle empty pallets and slip boards.
Daily inspection of equipment and change of forklift batteries.

Must be able to lift up to 50 lbs.

title: Packaging Quality Analyst
description:
JOB SUMMARY
The Quality Analyst will coordinate and perform daily quality testing and verification activities of the production lines while ensuring the highest quality product is ready for shipment. This is an “on the floor” position in the manufacturing environment with approximately 70% of the duties performed in manufacturing and 30% in the laboratory.
 
STATUS: 
Full Time 
LOCATION:
 Rochester, NY
DEPARTMENT: 
 Packaging Quality
JOB TYPE:
 Non-Exempt
SHIFT:
 
off shift, overnight 11pm-7am (Sun night - Thurs night), weekend and overtime as needed
 
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS & RESPONSIBILITIES
Product Safety and Quality 
Perform and monitor results of Quality Control testing to ensure product safety and quality specifications are met on our packaging lines.
Perform daily data review of Quality Control records to ensure accuracy and to identify process improvement gaps.
Aid management in new product/raw material qualifications.
Ensure non-conforming raw ingredients and finished goods are identified, properly placed on hold, communicated, and dispositioned per FIFCO USA food safety and quality policies. 
Work with all departments (Production, Maintenance, Quality, etc.) on non-conformance investigations, root cause, and corrective/preventative action.
 
General Laboratory Operations
Support management in day-to-day operation of Quality Control testing, inspection, and data collection (including, but not limited to: incoming raw materials, in process materials/products, and finished goods).
Ensure instrumentation used to perform testing/inspection are calibrated and verified with preventative maintenance completed.
Audit established SOP’s/Work Instructions for accuracy and update as needed.
Aid management in establishing and writing new SOP’s/Work Instructions for Quality Control Laboratory.
Formulate and interpret reports from testing data. 
Discern off notes and characteristics of products through taste and other senses.
Follow Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP’s).
Aid supervisor in completion of safety-related paperwork (including, but not limited to: injury reporting and Safety Data Sheet review). 
Keep up-to-date on all QC testing processes to help train new and existing employees. 
Actively exhibit a commitment to support a diverse and inclusive work environment.
Other duties as assigned. 
 
SPECIFIC LABORATORY TESTING
QC Lab
Set up and verify correct date codes on all packaging materials. 
Understand, troubleshoot, and make recommendations to improve pasteurization processes.
Verify use of correct product and packaging materials during production.
Dissect can packaging seams and make recommendations to improve the seaming process. 
Understand proper labeling compliance to state and federal regulations.
Satellite Lab
Demonstrate understanding and ability to coordinate the tank release process.
Perform CO2 receipts and testing. 
Perform testing instrument maintenance (Orbisphere, In-line air meters, etc.). 
Perform Brix, ABV, CO2, TPO, and Dissolved Oxygen tests as required. 
Perform volumetric testing as required. 
 
EDUCATION, SKILLS & EXPERIENCE
2-year college degree in a science-related field preferred. 
3+ years of related quality/laboratory experience in a food/beverage production facility preferred; or an equivalent combination of education and work experience will be considered.  
Trained in HACCP, federal food, and/or TTB standards is preferred but not required. 
Ability to read, write, and interpret documents in English.
Ability to ready, analyze, and interpret common trade journals, financial reports, and legal documents.
Ability to respond to common inquiries or complaints from customers, regulatory agencies, or members of the business community.
Ability to effectively present information to top management, employees, managers, vendors, and customers. 
Ability to work with mathematical concepts such as probability, statistical inference, fractions, percentages, ratios, and proportions and apply them to practical solutions. 
Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions.
 
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS & ENVIRONMENTAL CONDITIONS 
Must be able to regularly sit; use hands to handle or feel objects, tools, or controls; reach with hands or arms; and walk/climb stairs while carrying samples. 
Must be able to stand for extended periods of time, up to and potentially the full shift. 
Specific vision abilities include close vision and ability to adjust focus.
Must be able to occasionally bend, climb, lift, and/or move up to 50 lbs. 
Must be able to work with moving mechanical parts and loud noise levels.
Must be able to work with hazardous chemicals and frequently duck under conveyors and equipment. 
The pay rate for this position is $22/hr - $28/hr

title: Industrial Electrician
description:
JOB SUMMARY
The Industrial Electrician will be responsible for troubleshooting, repair, and preventative maintenance of all electrical systems within the brewery. 
 
STATUS: 
Full Time
SHIFT: 
Off-shift (afternoons/overnights); weekends and OT as needed
JOB TYPE:
 Union
LOCATION:
 Rochester, NY
DEPARTMENT: 
Maintenance
 
 
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS & RESPONSIBILITIES
Ensure the safety of all electrical systems within the brewery
Brewery-wide electrical support for all areas
Work on AC and DC, single and multiple phase circuits
Work in coordination with engineers and other technicians when working with devices and circuits
Perform cabling work for electronic equipment, computers, and telecommunications equipment
Repair or replace wires, cables or other fixtures using hand tools or electronic tools
Connect wires to transformers and other components
Plan and generate the layout of electrical installations and wiring
Possesses and utilizes working knowledge of our single line diagram and physical locations of sub-stations
Installation, removal, repair, and adjustment of pneumatic and electrical instruments/actuators
Observes automation in operation and troubleshoot to locate root cause of trouble
Install, service, and maintain power circuits; including synchronization of their operation
Initiate purchase orders for required parts
Support predictive and preventative maintenance initiatives
Actively exhibit a commitment to support a diverse and inclusive work environment
Other duties as assigned
 
EDUCATION, SKILLS & EXPERIENCE
Associate’s Degree in Electrical Engineering; Electrical Maintenance & Construction; or related field - preferred 
5+ years of industrial electrician experience
Will consider an Electrical Apprentice program 
 
OTHER ATTRIBUTES
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Knowledge and experience with industrial electrical and controls systems
Ability to troubleshoot, program, and debug AB & Siemens PLCs, HMIs, relay-based circuits and networking
Ability to troubleshoot, replace, and program VFDs
Ability to work independently
Ability to work in indoor and outdoor settings as well as within manufacturing, warehouse, and office environments
 
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS AND ENVIRONMENTAL CONDITIONS
Must be able to frequently walk, climb stairs/ladders, kneel in place, as well as crawl, stand, walk, and crouch under conveyors
Must be able to lift up to 50 lbs. 
Must be able to work indoors in a factory, outdoors on property, bench work in a maintenance shop, in noisy and humid temperatures as well as in cool, damp cellars. 
Must be able to work in confined spaces 
 
PERKS
Generous Benefits with options to fit your life
Blue4U Discounts
Retirement Options with employer contributions
10 paid holidays per year
Gainsharing Bonuses
Union Support
Tools and tool replacement options
Culture of pride and community involvement
And of course, beer! 
Pay Rate: $34.30/hr - $41.38/hr depending on qualifications and experience.

title: Senior Analyst, Operations Finance (must live in Western NY)
description:
JOB SUMMARY
The Senior Financial Analyst - Operations, is responsible for accurately stating the financial performance of the Rochester brewery and working with the management team to improve the financial performance of the business. The analyst must also be able to construct, monitor, and relay actual results vs. budget results to help the management team understand their financial objectives and outcomes.
 
 
STATUS: 
Full Time
LOCATION:
 Rochester, NY
DEPARTMENT: 
Operations Finance 
 
JOB TYPE:
 Exempt
 
 
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS & RESPONSIBILITIES
Assistance in creating, tracking, monitoring and reporting on the annual Operations cost budget.    
Work with the Operations team to explain budget variances and help identify corrective action to mitigate unfavorableness. Analyze results to provide Management with summary detail on overall Brewery performance through the use of monthly report cards.
Partner with all facets of the brewery to provide financial support including budgeting, forecasting, and ad hoc financial needs of operations.
Forecast and report conversion cost performance across all manufacturing departments on a monthly basis.
Collaborate with plant manger and department leads to help explain large variances to OB/MYR budgets.
Improve and update the current packaging capacity planning forecasting model based on new demand forecasts (S&OP).
Improve and update the annual budget process (including MYR).
Assist in developing all components of standards costs, including allocation of overheads. 
Support the analysis of COGS monthly operational results and variance analytics with the Ops Finance team (specifically looking at department labor and non-ingredient expenses).
Support in the creation and revision of yearly gainsharing levels and metrics. Track and report Gainsharing results on a quarterly basis.
Support CapEx business case builds to ensure future investments meet financial guidelines.
Financial analysis support as needed for the Plant manager, OPS Department managers, Dir. of Planning and Dir. of Operations Finance.                                        
Assist with internal and external audits. 
Translate operations budgets and forecasts into input requirements for FIFCO USA long range financial planning model as required by FIFCO USA CFO.
Improve and update the current packaging capacity planning forecasting model based on new demand forecasts (S&OP). 
Leadership role in collecting capital project input required to build Capital Expenditure long-range plans, annual budgets and forecasts and quarterly reviews with FIFCO USA CFO.                          
Support reporting improvements for tracking of open purchase orders and management of maintenance expenses and production supplies.
Support improvements required to migrate spare parts and supplies balances from expense to inventory accounting treatment.
Actively exhibit a commitment to support a diverse and inclusive work environment.
Other duties as assigned.
 
EDUCATION, SKILLS & EXPERIENCE
Bachelor's degree with a Finance concentration required
Experience in a manufacturing environment (preferably process manufacturing) required
Knowledge of or exposure to operations accounting is a plus
Advanced Excel skills are required 
ERP conversion project experience desirable           
 
 
PERKS
Generous Benefits with options to fit your life
Blue4U Discounts
Retirement Options with employer contributions
Gainsharing Bonuses
10 paid holidays per year
Flexible scheduling
Generous paid time off
Culture of pride and community involvement
And of course, beer!

title: Market Sales Manager (Albany, NY)
description:
JOB SUMMARY
The Market Manager is responsible for directing, motivating, developing capabilities, and managing wholesalers to achieve company targets and objectives. Specifically, the Market Manager will be responsible for the execution of sales and brand strategies with assigned wholesalers, while ensuring corporate brand standards are maintained at all times.  As a brewery representative, the Market Manager is expected to be an authority on product knowledge, brand positioning and programming in the marketplace.  
 
STATUS: 
Full Time
DEPARTMENT: 
Sales
 
GEOGRAPHY:
 Albany, NY - Remote (all applicants must reside within 30 miles of posting location upon employment) 
 
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS & RESPONSIBILITIES
Increase effective product placement and share of marketplace within the distribution network
Inventory management to ensure product availability within assigned market
Budget and revenue management to ensure profitability targets are met or exceeded
Optimize deployment of point of sale resources to grow distribution, display, and share of mind in the market (including on-time ordering of all TM & chain program POS).
Review wholesaler inventory levels weekly to ensure proper days on hand.  Communicate gaps and opportunities to ensure product availability.
Manage wholesaler ordering, confirmation, and tracking.  Oversee all FOB and PTR (QD's) for all brands and any price increases or post schedules in market.  Keeping in mind gross contribution and the effect on quarterly goals.
Provide direction to wholesaler to ensure execution of relevant chain and trade programming across market.
Plan work week and month to include work-with days with wholesalers to execute ABP and foster trust
Conduct market surveys and analyze VIP and IRI to identify opportunities, measure execution, and hold wholesalers accountable (Pareto with Purpose, Pics of Success, Provide Market Recaps).  Make sure PTC is correct at retail level (shelf tags, display POS with price, pricing gaps vs. competition pricing index).
Set up and/or attend promotional events to aid in the growth of FIFCO USA brands i.e. beer festivals, on premise promotions, off premise samplings, tournaments, crew drives, etc.
Directly engage key accounts to build relationships and execution in the market (Call Frequency i.e. Retail Entertainment).
Incentive (MBO) management - Externally work with wholesalers to set up sales incentives and retailers (where legal) as necessary to bring added value to brands and programming. Keeping within a budgeted amount to assure results and rate of sale for return on investment.  Internally manage FIFCO incentives directed towards driving sales and fulfilling programming (include chain team for options)
Build Annual Business Plan, align wholesalers and relevant chain accounts with annual region and company objectives and execution needed.
Monthly business reviews with manager and wholesalers.  Sales performance review monthly to identify gaps and plan to grow sales.  Update, plan and drive execution against the Annual Business Plan with wholesalers. (Include NA)
Track launches of brands and programs (new POD's / INBI) to gain focus and performance using VIP (National Chain Tracker and Goals)
Track and manage budget spending, field activation, travel, tactical, and sponsorships to ensure return on investment
Use CRM tool on market days and follow procedures to log trade marketing and display activity for account calls (highlight cadence for NA/DM joint calls, capabilities for recaps – buyer, MPPM, market visit) 
Present in front of wholesalers, retailers (indy vs. chain based opportunity), and sales teams – build (FIFCO USA standards) Power Point presentations, analyze VIP and IRI data to show gaps and areas for growth, showcase programs, new items and focus on SKUs to be able to ask for the sale and execution (ensure local FIFCO USA team is aligned and working towards same goal) 
Evaluate quarterly/trimester goals, make plan to achieve goals through preparation, incentives, market days, and communication (including national accounts) 
Timely submission of expenses and wholesaler invoicing; troubleshoot invoicing questions or issues
Actively exhibit a commitment to support a diverse and inclusive work environment
Other duties as assigned
 
EDUCATION, SKILLS & EXPERIENCE
Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience
Minimum 3 years management experience including people and wholesaler management, with at least 1 year of budget management experience
Intermediate knowledge of MS Excel, Word & PowerPoint
Valid driver’s license
Ability to lift up to 25 lbs 
Ascending or descending ladders, stairs, scaffolding, ramps, poles and the like
Moving about to accomplish tasks or moving from one worksite  to another
Adjusting or moving objects up to 25  pounds in all directions
Communicating with others to exchange information
Repeating motions that may include the wrists, hands and/or fingers
Operating motor vehicles or heavy equipment
Assessing the accuracy, neatness and thoroughness of the work assigned
Strong communication and relationship building skills with the ability to influence others
 
 
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS
Moving self in different positions to accomplish tasks in various environments including tight and confined spaces
Moving about to accomplish tasks or moving from one worksite to another
Communicating with others to exchange information
Assessing the accuracy, neatness and thoroughness of the work assigned
Light work that includes moving objects up to 20 pounds
 
 
PERKS
Generous Benefits with options to fit your life
Blue4U Discounts
Sales Bonus opportunities
Retirement Options with employer contributions
10 paid holidays per year
Car Benefit
Technology Reimbursements
Generous Paid Time Off
Culture of pride and community involvement

title: Intern - EHS (Fall Co-Op)
description:
JOB SUMMARY
The EHS Intern will assist with Environmental, Health, & Safety concerns for the facility. Gain experience in coordinating environmental activities including inspections, tracking, and planning for environmental compliance activities including but not limited to wastewater, air, hazardous waste, storm water, & SPCC.  Assist in ensuring adherence to regulatory requirements set forth by the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA), New York State Department of Environmental Conservation (NYSDEC), Occupational Health and Safety Administration (OSHA), local governmental agencies and third-party customer requirements as it relates to Safety, Health and Environmental. Gain experience with completing required trainings as it applies to current and future environmental & safety programs. Additionally, assist in providing the facility guidance in developing, implementing, and continuously improving programs to eliminate hazards and improve workplace safety.
 
 
STATUS: 
Full Time (40 hours)
LOCATION:
 Rochester, NY
DEPARTMENT: 
Environmental, Health & Safety
 
JOB TYPE:
 Non-Exempt
                                                                                                                                                         
*Interviews to begin mid-June/early July* 
 
ESSENTIAL FUNTIONS & RESPONSIBILITIES: 
Assists with coordinating environmental activities including inspecting, tracking, and planning for environmental compliance activities.
Assists, Implements and conducts required OSHA and internal safety training for all new hires, including employee annual refresher training.
Aid in implementing and continuously improving programs to eliminate hazards and improve workplace safety.
Assist in annual reviews of programs as they relate to Federal and State requirements (Mobile Equipment (ME), Fall Protection, Lock-Out Tag-Out (LOTO), Chemical Management / Hazard Communication, Emergency Preparedness)
Work on independent and collaborative Environmental and Safety projects.
Maintain balance of spending time on the shop floor for employee safety interaction along with maintaining the required time to complete the necessary reports and desk work.
Issue and maintain environmental submissions and reporting for required applications and permits.
Assist in maintaining, implementation, and completing accurate internal and external procedures, processes, reports, documentation, and logs, as it relates to environmental, health, & safety for the facility.  Communicate and train personnel as required.
Ensures proper safety equipment, required permits, and annual testing is available and/or completed for personnel so they may perform their duties: 
This may include, but is not limited to, Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) access, first aid station materials, hearing conservation program, hot work permits, lock out tag out (LOTO) equipment and confined space classifying.                                                        
 Participate in the accident process, included but not limited to: conducting post-accident investigations and prepares root cause/corrective action.
Actively exhibit a commitment to support a diverse and inclusive work environment.
Other duties as assigned.
 
EDUCATION, SKILLS & EXPERIENCE:
 
       
Must be enrolled in college or university.
Interested in gaining hands-on industry experience prior to graduation.
Effective interpersonal and communication skills which are essential for interacting with all levels of the organization.
Must be currently authorized to work in the United States for any employer.
Students majoring in Occupational Safety and Health, Safety Management, Environmental Science, or related fields preferred.
Proficiency with Microsoft Office, especially PowerPoint.
Strong technical writing capabilities.
Must be a U.S. Citizen or have Resident Alien status.
 
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS & ENVIRONMENTAL CONDITIONS: 
Must be able to frequently climb stairs, duck over and climb over conveyors/machines, and walk significant distances throughout the brewery.
Must be able to push, pull, crawl, and bend.
Must be able to lift a minimum of 25 lbs. and use hand tools/machinery as needed.
Must be able to do overhead work in limited circumstances/confined spaces.
Exposure to indoor and outdoor environments, including fluctuating temperatures

title: Regulatory Compliance Specialist
description:
JOB SUMMARY
Under the general supervision of Lead Regulatory Compliance Specialist, the Regulatory Compliance Specialist will ensure that FIFCO USA complies with local, state, and federal laws governing a range of matters including Federal and State licenses and permits, state product registrations, the labeling and marketing of alcohol beverages, development of new products, and consumer marketing promotions.
 
STATUS:              Full Time
LOCATION:         Buffalo, NY, Rochester, NY
DEPARTMENT:   Legal
JOB TYPE:          Exempt
 
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS & RESPONSIBILITIES
Responsible for alcohol product commercialization in a manner that complies with all applicable laws, including federal and state product registrations, renewals, and permits
Responsible for Federal and State alcohol license applications, renewals, and updates 
Assist with drafting terms and conditions for consumer marketing promotions and advertisements, as needed. 
Stay apprised of legislative updates to alcohol labeling  and advertising regulations
Work directly with sales and marketing departments on various legal duties
Work with various state agencies to register consumer marketing promotions
Maintain professional and clear communications with Federal and State regulatory agencies
Prepare legal summaries that can be easily understood by all Legal Department team members and internal clients outside of the Legal Department
Assist in creating and updating policies and Standard Operating Procedures based on changing regulations and laws
Advise Legal Department team members  on updated regulations and policies
Update legal guidelines and other resources that are provided to the commercial and non-commercial departments
Assess company operations to identify compliance risks
Assist, as needed, with federal and state audits.
Review and submit invoices and filing expense reports; obtain checks and maintain appropriate records
Actively exhibit a commitment to support a diverse and inclusive work environment
Other duties and projects as assigned by Lead Regulatory Compliance Specialist, Counsel, or General Counsel. 
 
EDUCATION, SKILLS & EXPERIENCE
At least 2 years of experience in a legal function (or related work experience) preferred. 
Bachelor’s Degree or Paralegal Certification preferred 
Experience in advertising and marketing law preferred
Experience researching laws and regulations and using that information to counsel via memos and oral advice preferred
Strong working knowledge of MS Office, including MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Teams
Ability to communicate, problem-solve, and multitask in an efficient manner
 
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS 
Hybrid: Mostly remote position in the Buffalo or Rochester areas, with a minimum of 1 - 2 days per month in Rochester or Buffalo office(s), depending on project needs
 
PERKS
Generous Benefits with options to fit your life
Blue4U Discounts
Retirement Options with employer contributions
10 paid holidays per year
Flexible scheduling
Generous paid time off
Technology reimbursement options
Culture of pride and community involvement
And of course, beer!

title: GBH Retail
description:

Sunday - Thursday | 11am-10pm
Friday & Saturday | 11am-11pm
 
As a
 
Gift Shop Team Member
, you'll assist the Brew House Manager with providing a great experience to our visitors, as well as communicate ideas and suggestions for improvements. The retail team member will participate in retail functions including, but not limited to:

title: GBH Tasting Bar Beertender
description:
JOB DESCRIPTION
 
Tasting Bar Beertenders will be working in our Pilot Brewery Bar, which is located on the first floor of the Brew House and is the primary service area for our flights and beer and food to go service. Tasting Bar Beertenders are responsible for educating guests on FIFCOUSA’s beer and beverage portfolio and the brewing process. We are looking for an outgoing and enthusiastic candidate with a passion for all things beer and Genesee! They should be comfortable with all aspects of service including pouring beer, taking drink and food orders, and cash handling. They will also support private events in the Tasting Bar. The employee will be responsible for maintaining positive guest relations throughout the guests’ experience. 
 
STATUS:
 Part Time
LOCATION:
 Rochester, NY
DEPARTMENT:
 Genesee Brew House Restaurant

ES

Become an expert in FIFCO USA culture and history

description:
BREW HOUSE HOURS OF OPERATION:
Availability Needed: All 
Preferred Availability: Daytime & Sundays
 
As a 
Host/Hostess
, you will be responsible for providing a warm and friendly immediate greeting to our guests at the door. You will be responsible for knowing all areas of service in the Brew House and able to direct guests to where they want to go. You will take names on a waiting list and give quotes when tables are not immediately available, run the floor, observe and keep track of the status of tables, and answer the phone. You will help to maintain and organize the host area, retail store, foyer, front entrance, and restrooms throughout your shift. Being passionate about beer, especially ours, is a plus!
 
SHIFTS: daytime & evening/
weekend 
availability
 on Saturday nights is a must
 
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS & RESPONSIBILITIES
Demonstrates genuine hospitality and sets the stage for an exceptional dining experience by making every single guest feel welcome 
Engages in friendly conversation and directs guests as they enter the Brew House

Answers the phone and attend to guest queries and reservations
Manage wait list and reservations in a high volume, fast paced restaurant 
Performs any cleaning tasks as required 
Performs additional assignments or miscellaneous administrative duties as assigned by managers
Actively exhibit a commitment to support a diverse and inclusive work environment

High school diploma or equivalent
Prior customer service experience
Ability to operate Table Management Software and Point of Sale systems 
Ability to lift and manage up to 20 lbs. (during various times throughout shift) and stand for long periods of time. 
 
SKILLS
Excellent communication skills (verbally interacts with management, servers, team members, and guests)
Must be able to read, write and determine wait time based on company's procedure
Must have excellent organizational skills and ability to multitask
Must have knowledge of workplace safety procedure
Reliability/Attendance: Impeccable

title: Mixed Blend - Brewing Operator
description:
JOB SUMMARY
The Brewing Operator supports the Brewing Department of the Genesee Brewery in Rochester, NY. This position is responsible for assembling, monitoring, inspecting & cleaning equipment to prepare product for packaging.
 
STATUS: 
Full Time
LOCATION:
 Rochester, NY
DEPARTMENT: 
Brewing Operations
 
SHIFT: 
Rotating; Weekends and OT as needed
JOB TYPE:
 Union
 
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS & RESPONSIBILITIES
Assemble equipment, and attach pipes, hoses, fittings, or valves, using hand tools. 
Monitor pressure gauges, and meters, flowmeters, thermometers, or products, and adjust controls to maintain specified conditions, such as feed rate, product consistency, temperature, air pressure, and machine speed. 
Record temperatures, amounts of materials processed, and/or test results on report forms. 
Start machinery such as pumps, feeders, or conveyors, and turn valves in order to heat, admit, or transfer products, refrigerants, or mixes. 
Read dials and gauges on panel control boards in order to ascertain temperatures, alkalinities, and densities of mixtures, and turn valves in order to obtain specified mixtures. 
Sample and test product characteristics such as specific gravity, acidity, and sugar content, using hydrometers, pH meters, or refractometers. 
Inspect and flush lines with solutions or steam, and spray equipment with sterilizing solutions. 
Measure or weigh specified amounts of ingredients or materials, and load them into tanks, vats, hoppers, or other equipment. 
Properly exhaust any excess co2 so as not to fill the surrounding cellar with gas 
Wash tanks following SOP for each cellar. 
Adhere to Good Manufacturing Practices (GMPs,) properly wear Personal Protective Equipment (PPEs) and follow all safety and company policies at all times.
Perform other duties as required.
Actively exhibit a commitment to support a diverse and inclusive work environment.
Other duties as assigned. 
 
EDUCATION, SKILLS & EXPERIENCE
High school diploma or equivalent.
Must be 21+ years of age.
Experience in brewing is preferred.
 
OTHER ATTRIBUTES 
Ability to use computers and computer-controlled equipment.
Ability to multitask, follow instruction and procedures, troubleshoot, and problem-solve in a fast-paced environment.
Ability to work with others in a team atmosphere as well as independently.
 
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS
Frequent walking and stair climbing is required. 
Ability to operate hand tools and machinery as needed.
Ability to lift and carry a minimum of 50 lbs., push, pull, climb, crawl, stoop, kneel and bend.
Exposure indoors in a factory including wet, cool, hot and humid environments. 
Moderate to high noise levels.
Ability to work in cellars in cool, damp spaces, confined spaces.
 
PERKS
Generous Benefits with options to fit your life
Blue4U Discounts
Retirement Options with employer contributions
10 paid holidays per year
Gainsharing Bonuses
Union Support
Tools and tool replacement options
Culture of pride and community involvement
And of course, beer! 
Pay Rate: $18.32/hr 
The referenced pay range represents step pay rates for this job, as set forth in the applicable collective bargaining agreement. Individual pay will be set in accordance with terms of the applicable collective bargaining agreement. 
 
*Drug Testing Statement: After a conditional offer of employment, a covered employer may require job applicant to submit a drug test.
 
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, genetics, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.
 
ALERT: Fraudulent Online Employment Scams
 
Always beware of online scams involving job offers! FIFCO USA does not make employment offers via social media or private messaging. Unfortunately, scammers have tried to collect and steal personal and confidential data by impersonating company employees. To protect yourself, never share your personal information through an insecure source online. FIFCO USA will never request any form of payment or payment information during the employment process.  
 For more information on this topic and helpful fraud prevention tips, please visit the FBI website at 
fbi.gov
.

title: Procurement Coordinator (Hybrid in Western NY)
description:
JOB SUMMARY
The Primary Packaging - Procurement Coordinator will handle and execute the organization's purchasing decisions, while maintaining adequate stock levels and staying within budget. Oversee the ‘procure to pay’ process of issuing purchase orders and in turn, ensuring goods and services are received on time and in full. The coordinator will also be responsible for tactical quoting entailing sourcing & negotiations.
 
STATUS: 
Full Time
LOCATION:
 3+ Days in Office (Hybrid)- Rochester, NY 
DEPARTMENT: 
Function Department
 
JOB TYPE:
 Exempt
 
 
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS & RESPONSIBILITIES
Tactical procurement of Primary Packaging components: Aluminum Cans, Glass, and Kegs
Create, enter, and maintain purchase orders and releases from suppliers in accordance with production scheduling to meet defined internal requirements.                  
Continues monitoring of product scheduling to ensure orders are placed and received as scheduled.            
Inventory Management System management.  Ensuring accurate inventory, pricing, and item card information.
Monitor onsite & off-site inventory reports and daily/weekly reports to ensure appropriate inventory levels are maintained.
Data management regarding bill of ladings to ensure accurate inventory.           
Proactively outline and place purchase orders in vendor portals and monitor throughout the product life cycle. 
Pursuing process optimization efforts to streamline procurement processes and procedures.
Incident report management – Log, report, inform and track incident reports for corrective actions and credits.  
Liaison between organization and vendors/agencies, and internal stakeholders.     
Work with Category Managers to:
 resolve invoiced pricing discrepancies. 
Align with corporate procurement strategies.
Manage vendor issues.
Work with internal stakeholders to develop planning needs/forecasts.                                                         
Build and maintain relationships with existing vendors.
Compare pricing and services to pursue the most profitable course in line with business objectives; continuously look for areas where costs can be reduced without sacrificing quality.
Gather and maintain metrics and data which support purchasing decisions.
Collaborate with the contract manufacturing team to efficiently onboard and maintain relationships with contract manufacturing partners.
Actively exhibit a commitment to support a diverse and inclusive work environment.
Other duties as assigned              .                                                                                                                                                                                                                       
EDUCATION, SKILLS & EXPERIENCE
A bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience; Degree in business, procurement or project management preferred.                                                                                                      
3-5 years in Procurement (Tactical/Sourcing), Finance, Product Development, Merchandising, sourcing.
Excellent communication skills
Self-organized and highly attentive to detail
Able to work in a fast-paced environment.
Strong skills in Microsoft Excel, Word, & PowerPoint.
Preferred: Experience in data analytics and related software (Tableau and/or Microsoft Power BI)
Preferred: Experience in BPCS or related Inventory management software
 
 
In the spirit of pay transparency, we are excited to share the base salary range for this position is $58,700 -$78,300, not including benefits or potential bonuses. title: Associate Brand Manager, Seagram's Escapes (Remote)
description:
JOB SUMMARY
The Seagram’s team manages a brand portfolio across the flavored hard beverage segment. The portfolio is anchored by its flagship, Seagram’s Escapes along side the growing Seagram’s Spiked, focused on c-store segment and the exciting new launch of Seagram's Refreshers.  The Seagram’s Brand plays in a fast paced and growing segment, fueled by exciting innovation opportunities and on trend break-through communications.                                                                                                                                              
                                                                                                    
STATUS: 
Full Time
JOB TYPE: 
Exempt
LOCATION:
 Remote
DEPARTMENT: 
Marketing
 
BRANDS:
 Seagram's Escapes 
 
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS & RESPONSIBILITIES
The Seagram’s Associate Brand Manager (ABM) will support the Brand Manager with the development and execution of national & local marketing campaigns along with commercial strategies and tactics designed to grow brand health and awareness, market share, volume and profitability across markets.
In order to support this work, the ABM will lead the detailed development and execution of exciting commercial campaigns and thematic programming. The ABM will work to ensure all activities align with key brand objectives, brand standards and legal guidelines.          
The ABM will also manage day-to-day activities and communications with support teams such as sales, sales operations, trade marketing, social media and public relations, brewery operations and outside agencies.                                                                                                                                
Support 360 activity planning through the development, implementation, and evaluation of programming in collaboration with other functions.
Oversee the development of localized brand activations in collaboration with sales regions / districts / chain account managers.               
Liaison and brief Trade Marketing, PR, Social Media and Innovation teams regarding relevant brand projects.              
Work closely with Trade Marketing, PR, Social Media and Innovation teams on the development, implementation, and evaluation of activation plans.
Lead execution of multi-media strategies and programs, while managing external agencies
Continuously innovate and optimize brand activations ensuring effectiveness and efficiency improvements.          
Contribute to the development of annual brand plans and lead relevant parts of it.
Develop activation, creative and media briefs for external agencies.              
Lead the development of Brand Key Message decks for new products, programs, and activations.        
Represent the brand with select external and internal stakeholders.
Support and contribute timely updates to the Seagram’s budget.  
Actively exhibit a commitment to support a diverse and inclusive work environment.
Other duties as assigned.
EDUCATION, SKILLS & EXPERIENCE
5+ years of experience in marketing, preferably within alcohol, beverage or other consumer packaged goods industry
3+ years of experience in budget and detailed project management
2+ years of leading projects across multiple functions
Previous brand management experience preferred
Demonstrated application of research/insights and data to make strategic recommendations
Experience with development and commercialization of CPG products  
Strong presentation skills as well as advanced knowledge of MS Excel, Word, and PowerPoint 
Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing or related field required; MBA preferred
3+ years of experience in marketing, preferably within beer or consumer packaged goods industry
Strong presentation skills as well as advanced knowledge of MS Excel, Word, and PowerPoint 
 
DESIRED ATTRIBUTES 
Entrepreneurial spirit and energy 
Natural curiosity and desire to dream big 
Creative & independent thinker
Excellent collaborator & communicator 
Team player
Organized
Self-motivated
 
PERKS
Generous Benefits with options to fit your life
Blue4U Discounts
Retirement Options with employer contributions
10 paid holidays per year
Flexible scheduling
Technology Reimbursements
Generous Paid Time Off
Culture of pride and community involvement
And of course, beer!  
 
In the spirit of pay transparency, we are excited to share the base salary range for this position is $84,600 -$127,000, not including benefits or potential bonuses. If you are hired at FIFCO USA, your base salary will be determined based on factors such as individual skills, qualifications, experience, and geographic location. In addition, we also believe in the importance of pay equity and consider the internal equity of our current team members as a part of any final offer. Please keep in mind that the range mentioned above is the full base salary range for the role. Hiring at the maximum of the range would not be typical in order to enable future & continued salary growth. We also offer a generous benefits package!
